The fine was related to payments Qualcomm made to Apple Inc. for the exclusive use of Qualcomm chips in iPhones. The court's decision cited procedural irregularities by the European Commission in its case against Qualcomm, rather than substantive competition law violations.

title: How HP went from takeover bait to one of Warren Buffett’s top tech bets
summary: Once considered takeover bait after its 2015 split, HP Inc. has seen a remarkable turnaround, becoming one of Warren Buffett's top tech investments. CEO Enrique Lores is driving this revival by diversifying into new high-growth markets like gaming and hybrid work and emphasizing sustainability, which has contributed significantly to sales. Despite the company's strong performance, Lores acknowledges that pandemic-driven growth is not sustainable and aims for steady growth from a higher baseline.

title: L3Harris in talks to buy Israeli spyware firm NSO - reports
summary: U.S. defence contractor L3Harris is reportedly in talks to acquire Israeli spyware firm NSO Group, a deal that would require approvals from U.S. and Israeli authorities and L3Harris's board. The potential acquisition raises concerns in the White House due to NSO's controversial Pegasus software, which has been used by governments to spy on individuals, leading to the company being blacklisted by the U.S. Commerce Department. If approved, the deal could potentially remove NSO from the banned list and allow its assets to be exclusively used with the United States and its allies.

title: Newmark Completes Sale of Moffett Green, Fully-Leased Trophy Campus in Silicon Valley
summary: Newmark has successfully completed the sale of Moffett Green, a 719,037 square-foot, fully-leased trophy office campus in Sunnyvale, California, to CommonWealth Partners, LLC. The transaction, which represents the largest single-asset investment office sale in Silicon Valley history, involved Meta Platforms, Inc. as the long-term tenant. Steven Golubchik and his team at Newmark facilitated the deal, highlighting continued investor demand for prime assets in high-barrier-to-entry markets and the strong performance of Moffett Park.

title: With shares of Kansas City’s Cerner turned over, sale to Oracle will close Wednesday
summary: Oracle's acquisition of Cerner Corporation for $28.3 billion is set to formally close on Wednesday, June 8th, following a successful stock tender offer. This acquisition marks Oracle's largest ever and signifies its entry into the healthcare market, with Cerner continuing as a dedicated subsidiary and Oracle pledging to grow jobs in Kansas City. The deal concludes Cerner's status as the largest private employer under local control in Kansas City, a company founded in 1979.

title: What Can a Multi-Factor Screening Methodology Do for Your Core Equity Exposure?
summary: This article discusses how applying a multi-factor screening methodology can improve risk-adjusted returns for large-cap equity portfolios. It highlights factors such as value, quality, and momentum, and introduces the FlexShares US Quality Large Cap Index Fund (QLC) which integrates these factors. The fund aims to provide benefits of these factor exposures while maintaining a similar risk profile to the broader large-cap market.

title: What Can a Multi-Factor Screening Methodology Do for Your Core Equity Exposure?
summary: This article discusses how applying a multi-factor screening methodology, focusing on value, quality, and momentum, can enhance core equity exposure for large-cap stock portfolios. It highlights research from FlexShares suggesting that this approach can deliver superior risk-adjusted returns compared to the broad large-cap market. The FlexShares US Quality Large Cap Index Fund (QLC) is presented as an example of an ETF that utilizes these factors.

title: 5 lessons I learned from helping to launch Tesla’s Model S
summary: The article shares five business lessons learned by Sukemasa Kabayama, the former President of Tesla Japan, during the challenging five-week launch of the Model S in Japan in 2014. These lessons emphasize creativity, holistic customer experience, laser focus on outcomes, the principle of "less is more," and clarity in problem-solving. Kabayama also draws parallels to his current startup, Uplift Labs.

title: Cleveland-Cliffs and TravelCenters of America return to Fortune 500
summary: Cleveland-Cliffs and TravelCenters of America have rejoined the Fortune 500 list. Walmart topped the overall list, followed by Amazon and Apple. The article also mentions other related business news.

title: Read This Before You Buy Any Udemy Course
summary: This article provides essential tips for purchasing courses on Udemy, emphasizing avoiding impulse buys due to frequent discounts and supporting instructors by using their direct links. It also advises against coupon sites and recommends buying courses via a desktop browser in incognito mode for the best pricing.

title: International Business Machines Corp. stock underperforms Friday when compared to competitors
summary: International Business Machines Corp. (IBM) stock fell 0.91% to $128.48 on Friday, May 20, 2022, underperforming the broader stock market, which saw the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average rise slightly. This marked the third consecutive day of losses for IBM, leaving its stock $17.51 below its 52-week high. While IBM declined, some competitors showed mixed performance, with Apple Inc. (AAPL) rising and Microsoft Corp. (MSFT) and Alphabet Inc. Cl A (GOOGL) falling.

title: SEIV ETF Analysis: Dividends, Returns CBOE:SEIV
summary: This article provides a detailed analysis of the SEI Enhanced U.S. Large Cap Value Factor ETF (SEIV), focusing on its dividends, returns, and key characteristics. It highlights SEIV as an actively managed fund targeting US large-cap value stocks using a quantitative-based selection process. The analysis covers AUM, expense ratio, holdings breakdown by sector and region, and dividend history, including a 24.49% increase in its last reported dividend.

title: Starbucks to cover employees’ travel expenses for abortions; gender surgeries
summary: Starbucks announced an expansion of its health care benefits to cover travel expenses for employees seeking abortions or gender-affirming procedures if these services are not available within 100 miles of their homes. This decision comes in the wake of a leaked draft U.S. Supreme Court opinion potentially overturning Roe v. Wade, with the company affirming its commitment to ensuring employee access to quality healthcare. Starbucks joins other major companies in offering this benefit, consistent with its history of advocating for liberal causes.

title: Home Audio Equipment Market size to Increase by USD 14.39 Bn | Featuring Top Vendors Including Apple Inc., Bose Corp., Koninklijke Philips NV, and Kripa Electronics India Pvt. Ltd. | Technavio
summary: The global home audio equipment market is projected to grow by USD 14.39 billion between 2020 and 2025, exhibiting a CAGR of 10.76%. This growth is primarily driven by rising disposable incomes and technological innovations, especially in the smart speakers segment. Key vendors include Apple Inc., Bose Corp., Koninklijke Philips NV, and others.

title: Unity Software loses $5 billion in market cap after Apple's changes lead to 'self-inflicted wound'
summary: Unity Software's market cap dropped by $5 billion after the company's attempts to circumvent Apple's IDFA changes backfired, leading to a "self-inflicted wound." Wall Street punished Unity U stock, slashing price targets by 43% as their workaround negatively impacted ad accuracy. Unity executives' strategy concerning Apple's mobile operating system changes proved ineffective, resulting in a significant market downturn for the company.

title: Online dating giant Match Group sues Google over app store
summary: Match Group, the company behind popular dating apps like Tinder and OkCupid, has sued Google, alleging an illegal monopoly in the Google Play Store and anticompetitive in-app payment policies. Match Group claims Google's 30% cut of in-app purchases and its mandate to use Google's payment technology are harmful, especially as Google threatened to remove Match apps from the Play Store if they don't comply with new rules. Google, in response, argues Match Group is trying to avoid paying for services and that the majority of apps on its platform do not pay fees.

title: How Citizens Financial used an iPhone plan to create a nationwide digital bank
summary: Citizens Financial Group Inc. launched its Citizens Pay iPhone upgrade plan in 2015, an early iteration of the buy-now-pay-later model. This initiative allowed Citizens to leverage its brand as a credit provider in conjunction with Apple's iPhone, helping customers bypass long waits for new iPhone releases. The article explores how this strategy contributes to Citizens' nationwide digital banking efforts.

title: Tinder owner Match sues Google in 'last resort' to avoid app-store booting
summary: Match Group Inc., owner of dating apps like Tinder, has sued Alphabet Inc.'s Google, describing it as a "last resort" to prevent its apps from being removed from the Google Play store. Match is contesting Google's policy of demanding up to 30% of sales from apps and threatening to block downloads unless Match uses Google's payment system exclusively. The lawsuit accuses Google of violating antitrust laws and seeks to protect Match from potentially hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue payments to Google.

title: Former Senior Vice President of Autonomous Driving at VW Group Alexander Hitzinger Joins Arbe Board of Directors
summary: Alexander Hitzinger, former Senior Vice President of Autonomous Driving at VW Group, has joined Arbe's Board of Directors. Hitzinger brings extensive experience from top automotive and new mobility firms, including Volkswagen and Apple, to Arbe. His addition is expected to help Arbe revolutionize the radar industry and advance safe autonomous driving solutions.

title: Korean Webtoon Companies that are giving the Audience Addictive Content
summary: The Korean webtoon industry is experiencing significant global growth, driven by the success of K-culture, despite challenges like increased competition and a decline in artists' average income in 2023. Key players like Lezhin Comics, Naver's Webtoon and Line Manga, KakaoPage, Ridi Corp's Manta, Toomics, and Tappytoon are expanding internationally, leveraging diverse genres, free-reading models, and innovative technologies like AI and NFTs. These companies are not only captivating worldwide audiences but also transforming the global entertainment landscape through partnerships and strategic investments.

title: Class Action Complaint Claims Apple, Google, Snap Liable for Facilitating 'Sexual Grooming' of Minors
summary: Apple, Google, and Snap Inc. are facing a class action lawsuit in California Southern District Court for allegedly enabling the sexual grooming of minors. The suit stems from a criminal case where Snapchat was used to coerce a minor into pornographic acts. The plaintiffs seek to compel the defendants to enforce policies to prevent such criminal conduct and comply with child abuse laws.

title: The Old Tech FAANG Is Dulled, But a New Version Has Promise
summary: Bank of America strategists have introduced "FAANG 2.0," a new grouping of sectors designed for a world facing inflation, war, and geopolitical shifts, replacing the underperforming original tech FAANG stocks. This new version, comprising fuels, aerospace and defense, agriculture, nuclear and renewables, and gold and metals/minerals, has shown significantly better market performance year to date compared to both the S&P 500 and the original tech FAANG stocks. The article highlights the rationale behind this shift, citing energy security, increased military spending, rising food prices, and gold's role as a refuge asset in the current global climate.

title: Tech sell-off pushes Nasdaq to steepest drop since June 2020
summary: A tech sell-off on Thursday, May 5, 2022 pushed the Nasdaq Composite to its steepest drop since June 2020, wiping out hundreds of billions in market value. This downturn was driven by disappointing earnings reports from cloud and e-commerce companies like Shopify, Amazon, and Meta, coupled with investor concerns following the Federal Reserve's interest rate hike to combat inflation. The rotation out of tech began in late 2021 due to inflation fears and escalated with events like Russia's invasion of Ukraine, leading to significant year-to-date losses for many "Covid winner" stocks.

title: Stock Splits Lead to Split Results in Trading
summary: This article analyzes the impact of stock splits on market structure, liquidity, retail investor participation, notional exposure, trade size, odd lots, and volatility in both equities and options markets. Using data from 61 stock splits since 2020, including a case study on Apple (AAPL), the Cboe team found that stock splits do not necessarily increase liquidity proportionally to the split ratio and can lead to a decrease in overall investor capital exposure, though they do increase retail investor participation. The study suggests while splits enhance accessibility, they may not always benefit existing shareholders.

title: With interest rates rising, it's time to focus on MANG stocks instead of FAANG, according to Jefferies
summary: Jefferies analysts recommend focusing on "MANG" stocks (Microsoft, Apple, Nvidia, and Alphabet) instead of the traditional "FAANG + Microsoft" group as interest rates rise. They suggest that MANG stocks present a safer investment strategy during the Federal Reserve's monetary policy tightening. This advice was issued prior to a Federal Open Market Committee meeting.

title: With interest rates rising, it's time to focus on MANG stocks instead of FAANG, according to Jefferies
summary: Jefferies analysts recommend focusing on "MANG" stocks (Microsoft, Apple, Nvidia, and Alphabet) over "FAANG + Microsoft" as interest rates rise and the Federal Reserve tightens monetary policy. This shift is presented as a safer investment strategy during an environment of increasing rates. The article highlights the rationale behind prioritizing this particular group of tech giants.

title: Top 10 Growth Stocks by Market Capitalization
summary: This article defines growth stocks and explains how they differ from other investment types, highlighting their potential for capital appreciation and typical reinvestment strategies. It then presents a list of the top 10 large-cap growth stocks as of April 2022, detailing their market capitalization, forward P/E ratio, dividend status, and specific growth drivers for each company. The article also touches on general market performance of growth stocks and factors influencing their volatility.

title: Nasdaq 100 Index: Tech Stocks Lose $1.8 Trillion in a Month Thanks to Fed
summary: Tech investors have experienced the worst start to the year in two decades, with the Nasdaq 100 Index losing over $1.8 trillion in value in April alone. This decline is attributed to a tumultuous earnings season, fears of an economic slowdown, and aggressive expectations regarding the Federal Reserve's rate-hike trajectory, with another hike anticipated next week. Investors are bracing for continued volatility in the market.

title: Fidelity Enters the Metaverse with New Financial Education Experience: Invest Quest at The Fidelity Stack
summary: Fidelity Investments has launched a new gamified financial education experience called "The Fidelity Stack" in Decentraland, an eight-story virtual building designed to teach users about ETF investing through an "Invest Quest" challenge. This initiative aims to engage younger audiences, particularly the 18-35 age range, following the company's recent introduction of a metaverse-themed ETF, FMET. Fidelity views this as a significant step in providing financial education in decentralized, virtual communities.

title: Warren Buffett and Berkshire Hathaway are once again outperforming the stock market. Apple is one big reason but these other 10 stocks also helped
summary: Warren Buffett and Berkshire Hathaway are once again outperforming the stock market, with Apple being a significant contributor. This article highlights Berkshire's excellent performance in 2022, contrasting it with the broader market's struggles. It also suggests that the idea of Buffett's investing style being outdated is itself becoming outdated.

title: LG Display quarterly profit plunges as demand shrinks and prices slide
summary: LG Display Co Ltd reported a 93% plunge in first-quarter operating profit, far below forecasts, due to shrinking demand for TVs, smartphones, and laptops, and fierce competition leading to declining panel prices. The company announced a strategic shift towards higher-end products and a reduction in the production of commoditized LCD TV panels, where Chinese rivals have a competitive edge. This downturn was exacerbated by China's COVID-19 lockdowns, which caused supply chain disruptions.

title: Low Volatility Stocks Usually Do Well—But There Are Traps
summary: A Northern Trust Asset Management paper warns that while low-volatility stocks generally outperform over time, they can present traps, particularly in real estate, utilities, and consumer staples sectors. Rising interest rates and economic vulnerability can negatively impact these types of low-volatility holdings. NTAM advises focusing on companies with strong cash flows, profitability, and solid balance sheets to mitigate these risks.

title: Apple planning to spend $19.3 million upgrading MetLife building in Cary
summary: Apple is planning to invest $19.3 million to upgrade a MetLife building in Cary, one year after announcing its new headquarters in Research Triangle Park. The renovations primarily involve interior work on floors 2-6 and 1,7 while the company recruits technical staff and engineers. This development is expected to significantly impact the local job market, housing, and bring further economic and philanthropic engagement to the Triangle region.

title: Netflix shares slide after it loses 200,000 subscribers
summary: Netflix shares plummeted after the company reported losing 200,000 subscribers in the first quarter of 2022, its first subscriber loss in over a decade. The decline was attributed to increased competition, economic headwinds, market saturation, and the withdrawal from Russia, leading to a significant drop in stock price and concerns about future growth. Netflix plans to address the issue by cracking down on password sharing and exploring new revenue streams like video games.

title: Netflix Loses $54 Billion in Market Cap After Biggest One-Day Stock Drop Ever
summary: Netflix experienced its biggest one-day stock drop ever, losing $54 billion in market capitalization after announcing its first subscriber loss in over a decade and projecting further losses. Analysts downgraded the stock, citing market saturation, increased competition, and the impact of account sharing, leading to a significant reassessment of the company's growth prospects.

title: Netflix loses 200,000 subscribers in first quarter
summary: Netflix reported a loss of 200,000 subscribers in the first quarter, missing its own projections and marking its first decline in over a decade. The company attributes the subscriber loss to password sharing, increased competition from other streaming services, and geopolitical events. Netflix is exploring new strategies to regain subscribers, including a lower-priced ad-supported service and cracking down on password sharing.

title: Apple helps suppliers rapidly accelerate renewable energy use around the world
summary: Apple announced that its suppliers more than doubled their use of clean power over the last year, with over 10 gigawatts operational out of nearly 16 gigawatts committed. 213 major manufacturing partners have pledged to power all Apple production with renewable electricity across 25 countries, accelerating progress toward Apple’s 2030 carbon neutral goal. Apple is also investing directly in renewable energy projects globally and supporting communities through its Power for Impact program.

title: Why did Buffett buy HP Inc (and should you invest too)?
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway recently acquired an 11.4% stake in HP Inc., making it Berkshire's second-largest tech position after Apple. This investment comes amidst concerns about inflation and the PC market, yet HP's strong fundamentals, consistent cash flow, strategic expansion into gaming and remote work solutions, and attractive valuation at a low P/E ratio and a 2.6% dividend yield, make it an appealing "boring but dependable cash machine" for value investors. The article questions whether individual investors should follow Buffett, advising personal research and considering pullbacks before investing.

title: Yelp Joins Apple, Citigroup, Other Companies Covering Travel Costs for Abortions
summary: Yelp Inc. announced it would provide financial assistance to employees and their dependents for out-of-state travel costs related to abortion care, expanding their health insurance benefits. This move follows similar actions by companies like Apple and Citigroup as more states introduce restrictive abortion laws. The expansion aims to support employees seeking reproductive healthcare in states where access is more readily available.

title: Snapchat Lawsuit Claims Executives Kept Investors In Dark About New Apple Privacy Restrictions
summary: A derivative lawsuit alleges that Snapchat executives, including CEO Evan Spiegel and CFO Derek Andersen, concealed from investors the negative impact Apple's new privacy features would have on Snap's advertising revenue. The lawsuit claims executives downplayed the effects, leading to a 26% drop in Snap's shares after a weaker-than-expected October 2021 earnings report. Plaintiff Vonmarie Thomas is seeking declaratory relief and restitution to Snap Inc. for alleged insider trading, unjust enrichment, and breach of fiduciary duties.

title: The Biggest Reveals from Bitcoin 2022
summary: The Bitcoin 2022 conference in Miami highlighted the early stage of Bitcoin adoption, with comparisons drawn to the internet in 1995. Key announcements included Robinhood rolling out crypto wallets and Lightning Network integration, new jurisdictions like Prospera (Honduras) and Madeira adopting Bitcoin as legal tender, and Strike partnering with major point-of-sale systems like Shopify and McDonald's to facilitate Bitcoin payments. The article emphasizes Bitcoin's potential for mass adoption and its disruptive impact on payment processing.

title: LIVEONE RECOGNIZED AS ONE OF 'THE BEST ANDROID MUSIC APPS FOR 2022' BY PC MAG
summary: LiveOne (Nasdaq: LVO) has been recognized by PC Mag as one of "The Best Android Music Apps for 2022," placing it alongside major streaming services like Amazon Music and Spotify. This marks a continued validation for LiveOne, which PC Mag previously called one of the "most complete streaming music services" and awarded its Editors' Choice. The recognition highlights LiveOne's curated channels, smart DJ hosts, and overall slick design as key factors in its appeal.

title: DeFiChain Adds New dTokens Corresponding to Disney, Intel, MicroStrategy, and iShares MSCI China ETF
summary: DeFiChain has announced the addition of four new decentralized tokens, or dTokens, following a community vote. These new dTokens correspond to Walt Disney Co ($dDIS), iShares MSCI China ETF ($dMCHI), MicroStrategy Incorporated ($dMSTR), and Intel Corporation ($dINTC), allowing users to gain price exposure to these traditional assets without ownership. DeFiChain, a blockchain built on the Bitcoin network, aims to provide decentralized financial applications and services, expanding its dToken universe to offer an alternative to traditional financial brokers.

title: Warren Buffett made about $650 million on HP after stake was revealed
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway saw its stake in HP increase by about $650 million to $4.85 billion after the company revealed its ownership of 121 million shares. HP's stock surged 15% following the disclosure, marking its best day in over two years. This swift market reaction highlights the continued influence of Buffett's investment decisions on investor behavior.

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway reveals major stake in HP, tech stock soars
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has acquired a significant stake in HP Inc., becoming the largest shareholder in the PC and printer manufacturer. This investment, valued at approximately $4.2 billion, caused HP's stock to surge by 14.7%. The move signals a renewed period of activity for Berkshire Hathaway and adds HP to Buffett's select portfolio of tech holdings.

title: Putnam’s Collins Draws On Nature For ESG Investing Inspiration
summary: Katherine Collins, head of sustainable investing at Putnam Investments, integrates biomimicry and insights from nature, specifically honeybees, into her ESG investment strategies. After a career in traditional finance and a master's degree from Harvard Divinity School, Collins applies a unique lens to identify companies demonstrating leadership in sustainability. Her approach focuses on balancing risk and opportunity, evidenced in her co-management of Putnam Sustainable Leaders (PNOYX) and Putnam Sustainable Future (PMVYX) funds.

title: HP finance manager went on $5m personal spending spree with company card
summary: Shelbee Szeto, a former HP finance planning manager, pleaded guilty to wire fraud, money laundering, and filing false tax returns after misappropriating approximately $5.2 million from the company. Szeto used company PCards to make payments to her own merchant accounts, then spent the funds on luxury items like Tesla and Porsche vehicles, high-end bags, and jewelry. Her sentencing is scheduled for July 20, 2022.

title: Perfect Corp.’s YouCam Apps Reach over 1 Billion Downloads Worldwide
summary: Perfect Corp.'s YouCam Suite of Apps has achieved "Super App" status, surpassing 1 billion global app downloads. The suite, which includes YouCam Makeup, YouCam Perfect, YouCam Video, and YouCam Nail, leverages AI and AR technologies for beauty, photo effects, and video editing, generating 1.68 billion virtual try-ons monthly. The company attributes its success to best-in-class AI and AR innovations, fostering a loyal community that spends over 530 million minutes monthly within the YouCam universe.

title: How To Multiply The QQQ’s Dividend Yield By 15
summary: This article criticizes the low dividend yield of Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) and suggests an alternative, Nuveen Nasdaq 100 Dynamic Overwrite Fund (QQQX), for significantly higher dividend income. The author explains how QQQX uses covered call options to generate a 7.3% dividend, contrasting it with QQQ's 0.5% yield and the less effective Global X Nasdaq 100 Covered Call ETF (QYLD). It highlights QQQX's strategy of cherry-picking profitable tech stocks and its advantage as a closed-end fund often trading at a discount.

title: Vornado's Vision for the Future of New York's PENN District
summary: Vornado Realty Trust is spearheading the transformation of New York City's PENN District, building on the success of the Moynihan Train Hall with significant public-private investment. The project focuses on creating an amenity-rich, post-pandemic office culture, attracting major tenants like Facebook and Apple, and revitalizing the area with new construction and updated iconic structures. This long-term vision aims to create a vibrant, livable city center and a comprehensive ecosystem for businesses and residents alike.

title: Electronic Arts stops sales in Russia, bans Russian teams from esports events
summary: Electronic Arts has ceased sales of its games, content, and virtual currency in Russia and Belarus in response to the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. The company has also removed Russian teams from its sports video games FIFA 22 and NHL 22, and banned teams from both Russia and Belarus from competing in official esports events. This action comes amidst a broader trend of companies, including Microsoft and CD Projekt Group, pulling out of the Russian market and following an appeal from Ukraine's deputy prime minister.

title: Netflix stock has now lost all its gains from the pandemic
summary: Netflix's stock has lost all its gains from the pandemic, with shares falling to a 52-week low of around $332 and being more than 50% down from its mid-November high of $700.99. This decline is attributed to consumers returning to out-of-home entertainment, increased competition from other streaming platforms, and underwhelming subscriber growth forecasts, prompting Netflix to rethink its strategy and raise prices. Analyst Michael Pachter suggests that competition makes it harder to retain customers and increases content costs, while competitors are less likely to license content to Netflix now that they have their own platforms.

title: Metaverse Technology Redefining Digital Experience
summary: The metaverse is emerging as a significant technological advancement, moving beyond gaming to redefine digital experiences across various industries. Companies like Facebook (Meta), Nike, and Microsoft are investing heavily, with projections indicating global metaverse revenue could approach $800 billion by 2024. While offering potential for retail, enterprise solutions, and new markets like virtual real estate and entertainment, the metaverse also faces challenges related to data security, legal frameworks, skilled resources, VR device limitations, and potential negative societal impacts.

title: IonQ to Present Research at American Physical Society (APS) Annual Meeting 2022
summary: IonQ announced its participation in the American Physical Society (APS) March Meeting 2022, where co-founder and CTO Jungsang Kim will be honored for his pioneering contributions to quantum computing. IonQ researchers will present new advances in quantum chemistry simulations, risk aggregation using quantum generative modeling, and general quantum learning of joint probability distribution functions. The company will also discuss application-oriented performance benchmarks for quantum computing, including its new #AQ single-number benchmark.

title: Autodesk Inc. stock falls Friday, underperforms market
summary: Autodesk Inc. (ADSK) stock dropped 3.74% on Friday, closing at $192.31, underperforming the broader market which also saw declines with the S&P 500 Index and Dow Jones Industrial Average falling. This marks the second consecutive day of losses for Autodesk, leaving it significantly below its 52-week high. The stock's performance was also mixed compared to competitors like Apple, Adobe, and Synopsys, all of which also experienced declines.

title: Autodesk Inc. stock falls Friday, underperforms market
summary: Autodesk Inc. (ADSK) stock fell 3.74% on Friday, closing at $192.31, underperforming the broader market as the S&P 500 and Dow Jones also declined. This marked the second consecutive day of losses for the company, with its stock trading significantly below its 52-week high. Competitors like Apple, Adobe, and Synopsys also experienced declines, while Autodesk's trading volume exceeded its 50-day average.

title: Amazon announces 20-for-1 stock split
summary: Amazon announced a 20-for-1 stock split, following similar moves by other major tech companies like Alphabet, Apple, and Tesla. The article explains that a stock split divides existing shares into multiple, smaller-priced shares without changing the overall value of an investor's holdings or the company's market capitalization. Stock splits are often done to increase a stock's liquidity and make it more accessible to a wider range of investors, though in an era of fractional shares, some of the practical impact is diminished.

title: Why Nvidia sees a future in software and services: Recurring revenue
summary: Nvidia is shifting its business model to focus on software and services to generate recurring revenue, moving beyond its traditional hardware sales. CFO Colette Kress highlighted opportunities in autonomous vehicles, where Nvidia's software will be monetized over the life of the car, and the metaverse, envisioning annual revenues of $1,000 per creative user and per digital twin bot. This strategic pivot aims to create more predictable income streams, leveraging existing hardware with new software offerings and expanding into new markets.

title: Our Ultimate Stock-Pickers' Top 10 Buys and Sells
summary: This article identifies the top 10 high-conviction buys and sells among Morningstar's Ultimate Stock-Pickers for the fourth quarter of 2021, based on an aggregate analysis of their holdings. It highlights key companies like Microsoft and 3M as top buys and Marsh & McLennan as a prominent sell, detailing the Morningstar analysts' fair value estimates, economic moats, and investment theses for these firms. The report assists investors by providing insights into attractive investment ideas and valuation considerations.

title: EPAM Shares Continue to Fall on Ukraine Crisis & Russia Exit
summary: EPAM Systems' shares fell significantly due to the escalating Russia-Ukraine crisis and the company's decision to exit Russia. EPAM, with substantial exposure in Eastern Europe, announced it would discontinue services in Russia and offer humanitarian aid to Ukrainian employees, aligning with U.S. sanctions. The conflict is expected to impact the company's revenues and profitability due to its large workforce in the affected regions.

title: Microsoft closes on $16 billion acquisition of Nuance
summary: Microsoft has completed its $16 billion acquisition of speech recognition company Nuance Communications. This deal, Microsoft's second-largest, aims to expand its presence in the healthcare industry through Nuance's medical dictation and transcription tools. The acquisition received clearance from British and European Union antitrust regulators after initial scrutiny.

title: First U.S. refiner suspends purchases of Russian crude for Hawaii refinery
summary: Par Pacific Holdings Inc. has announced it will suspend purchases of Russian crude oil for its Hawaii refinery, becoming the first U.S. refiner to publicly do so after sanctions imposed due to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The company plans to source crude from North and South America and was the fifth largest U.S. importer of Russian crude in 2021. This move comes as other Western companies halt Russian operations and the U.S. considers further sanctions on Russia's oil sector.

title: Crypto exchanges won't bar Russians, raising fears of sanctions backdoor
summary: Major cryptocurrency exchanges are refusing to implement a blanket ban on Russian users, despite Western sanctions targeting Moscow and a plea from the Ukrainian government. They argue that a full ban goes against the libertarian ethos of cryptocurrency, though they will block accounts of individuals explicitly targeted by sanctions. This stance raises concerns among anti-money laundering specialists that crypto could serve as a loophole for Russians to circumvent financial isolation.

title: Google, Meta face penalties in Russia as deadline passes to open local offices
summary: Google and Meta are among several internet companies facing potential penalties in Russia for failing to establish local offices and comply with a new communications law. Russia's state communications regulator, Roskomnadzor, had set a deadline of the end of February for these companies to open local offices or face restrictions. The move is part of Russia's broader effort to control internet content, with fines previously issued for failing to censor anti-government content, and recent curtailments of access to platforms like Facebook in retaliation for censoring state media.

title: Kraft Heinz taps Google for multiyear transformation push
summary: Kraft Heinz announced a multiyear strategic partnership with Google to accelerate its digital transformation, leveraging Google Cloud's AI and ML to drive food innovations, build a customer data platform, and improve media efficiency. This initiative is part of Kraft Heinz's broader strategy to reinvest in its brands and achieve cost savings by 2024, enabling data-driven decisions as consumer behavior shifts online. The partnership aims to enhance personalization at scale, optimize media activations, and address changing market challenges amid the pandemic.

title: Salesforce ties executive compensation to ESG goals
summary: Salesforce announced that a portion of executive variable pay for those at the executive vice president level and above will be tied to ESG measures, starting this fiscal year. These measures will focus on increasing representation for diverse employees and reducing air travel emissions, as well as increasing spend with suppliers signed onto Salesforce's Sustainability Exhibit. This move reflects a growing trend among major companies to link executive compensation to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) and sustainability goals.

title: FDA approves first iOS app to control insulin pump
summary: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has approved the t:connect app for iOS and Android, making it the first app capable of controlling a user's insulin pump. This app, used with Tandem Diabetes Care's t:slim X2 insulin pump, allows users to program and cancel bolus insulin requests directly from their smartphone. The t:connect app also displays 24 hours of glucose trends, pump status, and insulin therapy data.

title: SPYG, VOOG, And IVW: It's Gut Check Time For Owners Of These S&P 500 Growth Funds
summary: This article examines three S&P 500 Growth Index ETFs: SPYG, VOOG, and IVW, highlighting their strong past performance and heavy concentration in mega-cap stocks. It suggests that while these funds are solid long-term choices, current market conditions, including a downward trend in earnings surprises, might present a better entry point in the future. The author also suggests considering the Invesco S&P 500 Pure Growth ETF for a different approach.

title: Power Moves | GQ Middle East’s New Editor-in-Chief, PVH Corp. Appoints CFO
summary: Ahmad Swaid, former head of content at Dazed Media, has been appointed as the new editor-in-chief of GQ Middle East. PVH Corp. (owner of Tommy Hilfiger and Calvin Klein) has named Jack Coughlin as its new chief financial officer. Additionally, Sephora appointed Marc Abergel as global chief digital officer, and Lisa Bridgett became CEO of the interactive styling game Drest.

title: Knowles Celebrates 75 Years Of Industry Firsts And Leadership In The Audio Industry
summary: Knowles Corporation celebrates 75 years of innovation and leadership in the audio industry, from its founding in 1946 to its current status as a market leader in audio components. The article highlights key milestones such as the development of miniature microphones for hearing aids, the groundbreaking SiSonic MEMS microphones, and balanced armature drivers that have revolutionized both medical and consumer audio. Knowles continues to drive advancements in areas like TWS earphones, voice control, and space exploration, shaping the future of how we interact with sound.

title: Xiaomi sharpens focus on high-end smartphones to challenge Apple
summary: Xiaomi founder Lei Jun has announced the company's strategic shift to focus on the high-end smartphone market, aiming to challenge Apple and become China's top high-end brand within three years. This move comes as Xiaomi seeks to overcome intense competition and continue its growth, investing 100 billion yuan (US$15.71 billion) in R&D over the next five years. The company also plans to expand its retail presence in mainland China by rolling out 20,000 more stores over the next three years to achieve its goal of becoming the world's top smartphone vendor by 2024.

title: Nvidia’s Arm deal: Largest-ever chip merger terminated over ‘significant regulatory challenges’
summary: Nvidia's $40 billion acquisition of Arm Limited, which would have been the largest chip merger in history, has been officially terminated due to significant regulatory challenges globally. SoftBank, Arm's parent company, will retain a $1.25 billion breakup fee from Nvidia and plans to take Arm public by March 2023. Analysts suggest the termination is a "plus" for Arm, allowing it to maintain impartiality as an IP purveyor, and while a "setback" for Nvidia, it won't derail its progress in AI.

title: SoftBank’s sale of Arm to Nvidia collapses, Arm to IPO
summary: The proposed sale of Arm Ltd by SoftBank Group Corp to U.S. chipmaker Nvidia Corp has collapsed due to regulatory hurdles and scrutiny from various international bodies. Instead of the sale, which was valued at up to $80 billion, Arm will now plan for an initial public offering (IPO). The deal faced opposition from U.S., British, EU, and Chinese regulators over concerns about competition, pricing, and innovation in vital chip markets.

title: Nvidia’s $40bn takeover of UK chip designer Arm collapses
summary: Nvidia's $40bn takeover of UK chip designer Arm has collapsed due to insurmountable regulatory hurdles, leading Arm to pursue a stock market flotation instead. The deal, which had been valued as high as $75bn, faced fierce opposition and regulatory scrutiny in multiple regions, including the US, UK, and China. Softbank will now prepare Arm for an IPO and receive a $1.25bn break-up fee from Nvidia.

title: Tim Cook Reaffirms Commitment to Being Carbon Neutral
summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook recently reaffirmed the company's commitment to becoming carbon neutral across its supply chain and products by 2030, a goal initially announced in 2020. This commitment was highlighted during the company's first-quarter earnings announcement, which reported record revenue. Investors interested in ESG-aligned exposure to Apple can consider the SPDR S&P 500 Fossil Fuel Reserves Free ETF (SPYX), which holds AAPL as its top position.

title: International Funds Stop Fresh Transactions. Is It a Worrying Sign?
summary: Mutual fund investors were surprised when fund houses stopped fresh transactions in schemes offering exposure to offshore equities. This industry-wide decision was prompted by the Indian mutual fund industry reaching its overall investment limit of USD 7 billion in offshore securities, set by the RBI in 2008. While many funds have temporarily suspended inflows into schemes with overseas exposure, certain overseas ETFs may still accept investments as they fall under a separate, unbreached limit.

title: Alphabet eyes $2 trillion value after blowout results
summary: Alphabet Inc. is on the verge of joining Apple and Microsoft in the $2 trillion market valuation club after a strong quarterly report led to an over 8% surge in its shares. The company also announced a 20-to-1 stock split, aiming to make shares more accessible to retail investors. At least 20 brokerages raised their price targets on Alphabet's stock.

title: This Just In: HBO Documentary ICAHN: THE RESTLESS BILLIONAIRE Debuts February 15
summary: HBO documentary "ICAHN: THE RESTLESS BILLIONAIRE," directed by Bruce David Klein, will debut on February 15, exploring the life and career of financier Carl Icahn. The film chronicles his rise from humble beginnings, his significant financial deals and corporate takeovers, and his controversial legacy as both a corporate raider and shareholder activist. It features commentary from family members, journalists, and industry titans, detailing his impact on Wall Street and various companies.

title: Alphabet brings big stock splits back to market
authors: Jeran Wittenstein and Vivianne Rodrigues and Bloomberg
summary: Alphabet Inc. announced a 20-for-1 stock split, aiming to make its shares more accessible to small investors by reducing the per-share price. This move is also seen as a step towards potential inclusion in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which has historically been a barrier due to Alphabet's high stock price. The announcement led to a 10% jump in shares during premarket trading.

title: LGD and BOE Competing with SDC for Larger Share of iPhone Business
summary: LG Display (LGD) and BOE are increasing their competition with Samsung Display (SDC) for a larger share of Apple's iPhone OLED panel supply. While Samsung has historically dominated, Apple's strategy to minimize dependency has encouraged LGD and BOE to expand capacity and technology, leading to forecasted shifts in panel supplier percentages for future iPhone models. Chinese display manufacturers like BOE, Visionox, and CSOT are also significantly investing in flexible OLED screens, challenging South Korean dominance and aiming to capture a larger portion of the growing foldable smartphone market.

title: Google parent Alphabet announces 20-for-1 stock split
summary: Alphabet, Google's parent company, announced a 20-for-1 stock split following a surge in its stock price. This move aims to make shares more accessible to a wider range of investors by significantly lowering the per-share cost. The split requires shareholder approval and will involve Class A, B, and C shares, with existing holders receiving 19 additional shares for each one they own by July 15.

title: General Motors Wants to Hire 8,000 Highly Skilled Workers, Technologists
summary: General Motors announced plans to hire 8,000 highly skilled workers, including software developers and computer scientists, in 2022 to boost its technological capabilities and compete with companies like Tesla. While GM aims to innovate, it faces challenges in attracting top talent due to lower compensation compared to tech giants and Tesla, possibly relying on benefits and perks instead. The automotive industry is increasingly investing in advanced car technologies, making the acquisition of skilled technologists crucial for future success.

title: The 3 Best Carbon Stocks of 2022
summary: This article highlights the top three carbon-related investment opportunities for 2022, emphasizing the growing importance of carbon markets and green investing. It details the KraneShares Global Carbon Strategy ETF (KRBN) for broad market exposure, Carbon Streaming Corporation (NETZ/OFSTF) as an early mover in carbon credit streaming, and Brookfield Renewable Partners (BEP) for a more conservative renewable energy play. The article underscores how increasing net-zero ambitions among corporations and rising awareness of climate change will drive investor interest in these sectors.

title: How the ‘world's first’ AI-managed ETF stacks up, almost five years later
summary: This article reviews the performance and evolution of AIEQ, the "world's first" AI-managed ETF, nearly five years after its debut. Despite initially underperforming the S&P 500, AIEQ has grown in assets, team size, and model sophistication, though it has faced recent headwinds. The article details how the fund, run by EquBot, uses tens of thousands of proprietary AI models and IBM Watson to analyze structured and unstructured data, emphasizing its commitment to explainability and transparency.

title: Warren Buffett has nearly caught up with Cathie Wood after the tech-stock guru vastly outperformed him in 2020
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has nearly caught up to Cathie Wood's Ark Innovation ETF in terms of performance since the start of 2020, narrowing the gap from over 200 percentage points to just 5. While Wood's fund soared during the initial pandemic tech boom, it has since fallen due to investors pulling out of growth stocks in anticipation of interest-rate hikes. This shift highlights the differing investment strategies of Buffett's value-oriented approach and Wood's focus on disruptive growth companies.

title: Netflix tanks again as investors question growth prospects
summary: Netflix shares continued to fall after the company announced a significant slowdown in subscriber growth, missing analyst forecasts and marking its slowest annual growth pace since 2016. Despite these challenges, some Wall Street analysts remain optimistic, viewing the subscriber shortfall as a forecasting issue rather than an existential threat, particularly given Netflix's strong international expansion prospects.

title: Cantaloupe Inc. celebrates 30 years of technology innovation in unattended retail
summary: Cantaloupe Inc., formerly USA Technologies, is celebrating 30 years of innovation in autonomous retail, having pioneered cashless vending and continuously evolving its technology. The company has seen significant growth in active points of sale and revenue, driven by enhancements to its Seed platform with AI, partnerships for cryptocurrency payments, and integrations for mobile wallets. Cantaloupe attributes its success to being at the intersection of autonomous technology, IoT transformation, and integrated digital payments, as well as market research showing the preference for digital payments and growth driven by younger consumers.

title: Netflix raises monthly subscription prices in U.S., Canada
summary: Netflix has increased its monthly subscription prices in the U.S. and Canada by $1 to $2, depending on the plan, to fund new programming and maintain competitiveness in the streaming market. The standard U.S. plan now costs $15.49, up from $13.99, while the Canadian standard plan rose to C$16.49 from C$14.99. These increases, the first since October 2020 in these markets, reflect Netflix's pricing power as it faces growing competition from other major streaming services.

title: Here’s Why the UPRO and TQQQ Stock Prices Fell 50.1% Premarket Despite Calm Markets
summary: The ProShares UltraPro S&P500 (UPRO) and ProShares UltraPro QQQ (TQQQ) ETFs both fell about 50% in premarket trading. This significant drop was due to previously announced forward stock splits by ProShares, intended to make the shares more affordable to a wider range of investors, not due to market instability. The splits ensure the total value of investors' holdings remains unchanged, similar to traditional stock splits seen with companies like Apple and Tesla.

title: Behind the Scenes With Cigna Ventures: Giving Great Ideas the Momentum To Make an Impact
summary: Cigna Ventures, the strategic venture fund of Cigna Corporation, focuses on improving health care affordability, simplicity, and predictability by partnering with innovative entrepreneurs. The fund invests across three key areas: Health Care Insights and Analytics, Digital Health and Experiences, and Care Delivery and Enablement. Through these investments, Cigna Ventures aims to accelerate Cigna's strategy, bring innovation into the organization, and bring differentiated value to Cigna customers and the healthcare system.

title: JVAL Stock Price | JPMorgan U.S. Value Factor ETF
summary: This article provides detailed information about the JPMorgan U.S. Value Factor ETF (JVAL), including its current stock price, trading exchange (NYSE), and comprehensive financial metrics such as dividend yield, expense ratio, and market capitalization. It also offers technical analysis insights and lists the ETF's top holdings, outlining its investment strategy as a value-focused equity fund targeting the U.S. market.

title: Lumentum hooks up with Hesai on auto lidar
summary: Lumentum has partnered with Hesai Technology to ramp up production of VCSEL-based lidar sensors for automotive applications, specifically the AT128 hybrid solid-state lidar units. These sensors, using Lumentum's 905 nm vertical emitter arrays, are designed for advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) and aim to significantly improve lidar cost competitiveness and scalability. Both companies anticipate volume shipments of these sensors to begin this year from Hesai's new manufacturing center, which has a planned capacity of over 1 million units.

title: Smart Water for a Smarter Home: Moen Leads the Way with Industry's First Whole-Home Connected Water Product Suite
summary: Moen introduces the industry's first whole-home smart water ecosystem, the Moen Smart Water Network, which allows consumers to control, monitor, and conserve water throughout their homes using a single smartphone app. The network includes new and expanded smart products like the Flo Smart Water Monitor and Shutoff, Smart Leak Detector, Smart Sump Pump Monitor, Smart Faucet with Motion Control, and Smart Shower, all designed to provide peace of mind, security, and personalized water experiences. These innovations offer automated water security, water usage education, personalized settings, and voice activation capabilities for a truly connected home water system.

title: Shun Concentration Risk With Equal-Weight ETFs
summary: This article discusses the increasing concentration risk in cap-weighted S&P 500 indexes due to the massive market capitalization of a few tech giants like Apple and Microsoft. It promotes equal-weight ETFs, such as the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP), as a solution to this problem, highlighting their comparable performance with superior diversification. The piece draws historical parallels to the tech bubble, emphasizing the benefits of a less concentrated portfolio.

title: Shed Concentration Risk With Equal-Weight ETFs
summary: This article discusses the increasing concentration risk in cap-weighted indexes like the S&P 500, primarily due to the large market capitalization of a few tech giants like Apple and Microsoft. It advocates for equal-weight exchange-traded funds (ETFs), such as the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP), as a solution to provide comparable returns with superior diversification. The article highlights how equal-weight ETFs mitigate the risks associated with an over-reliance on a few mega-cap stocks.

title: Dolby Survey: GenZ Could Save Music Sound Quality!
summary: A Dolby-sponsored OnePoll survey suggests that GenZ could be the generation that prioritizes and drives demand for high-quality audio, contradicting previous trends where convenience often overshadowed sound fidelity. The survey indicates GenZ's strong preference for lossless sound quality, high-end audio devices, and even older music, potentially signaling a significant shift in the consumer audio market.

title: Allstate’s Arity auto insurance predictions for 2022
summary: Allstate's Arity has released three major predictions for auto insurance in 2022 based on extensive driving data. These predictions include rising car insurance rates due to riskier driving behaviors post-pandemic, the increased use of driving scores for new policy pricing, and more equitable and transparent pricing for consumers through greater reliance on individual driving data. The article highlights that these trends will lead to competitive advantages for insurers who leverage telematics data at the point of quote.

title: Apple's App Store broke competition laws, Dutch watchdog says
summary: The Netherlands' competition regulator, ACM, has found that Apple Inc. broke competition laws with its App Store payment policies, specifically concerning dating apps. Apple is ordered to allow alternative payment systems for dating apps and faces a fine of up to 50 million euros if it fails to comply by January 15. Apple has stated it disagrees with the order and has filed an appeal.

title: Apple’s Next Step in Services Could Be New Bundles, Deeper Integration
summary: Apple's future services strategy is expected to focus on deeper integration among its existing offerings and the introduction of new bundles, building on the success of its services division. This push includes the hiring of Facebook's AR/VR communications chief, signaling potential new product categories like headsets. The article also notes the impact of rising Covid cases on Apple's retail operations and its plans for CES.

title: Apple Must Answer Shareholder Questions on Forced Labor, SEC Says
summary: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission denied Apple Inc.'s request to block a shareholder proposal seeking greater transparency on its efforts to prevent forced labor in its supply chain. This means Apple will face a vote on the proposal at its next annual shareholder meeting. The request asks for details on identified risk suppliers and actions taken against them.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: Moody's gives Apple top 'AAA' credit rating on growth promise
summary: Ratings agency Moody's upgraded Apple Inc.'s long-term credit rating to 'AAA' with a stable outlook, citing its exceptional liquidity and robust earnings. This places Apple in an elite group of companies with the highest rating. While Apple's financial performance was strong in fiscal 2021, the company faces execution risks from short product cycles, shifting consumer preferences, and supply chain management.

title: Apple’s long-term credit rating upgraded to AAA by Moody’s
authors: Jack Pitcher and Mark Gurman and Bloomberg
summary: Moody’s Investors Service upgraded Apple Inc.’s long-term credit rating to Aaa, placing it in an exclusive group with Microsoft and Johnson & Johnson as the only U.S. S&P 500 corporations with the highest possible credit score. This upgrade reflects Apple's exceptional liquidity, robust earnings, and strong business profile, as the company continues to focus on a net cash-neutral position and expand into new markets like augmented reality and cars. Despite potential chip-related supply shortages impacting revenue, investors remain optimistic about Apple's long-term prospects.

title: 5 things to know about Oracle after $28.3 billion acquisition of Kansas City’s Cerner
summary: Oracle has announced a $28.3 billion acquisition of Cerner Corp., Kansas City's largest private employer, marking one of the year's biggest deals. This move signifies Oracle's growing push into the healthcare industry, following similar expansions by other tech giants. The acquisition brings together Oracle, an $280 billion company with 133,000 employees globally, and Cerner, valued at $23 billion with 28,000 employees worldwide, notably 13,000 in Kansas City.

title: Amazon silenced criticism of Xi to do business in China: Report
summary: A Reuters report alleges that Amazon.com Inc. quieted criticism of President Xi Jinping's book on its Chinese platform to maintain business in China. This involved scrubbing negative ratings and reviews for "The Governance of China" following requests from Beijing. This situation mirrors cases of other US companies like Apple and contrasts with others like Yahoo! and LinkedIn that have exited the Chinese market due to a challenging business environment.

title: Apple Should Make a Giant iPad as Its Smart Home Portal
summary: After testing Amazon's new Echo Show 15, the author suggests Apple Inc. (AAPL) should develop a larger iPad to serve as a smart home hub. This move would enhance Apple's presence in the smart home market and diversify the utility of its iPad line. The article also touches on other Apple-related news, including COVID-19 disruptions and internal company changes.

title: About IBS Bulgaria
summary: IBS Bulgaria is helping regional banks modernize their critical systems to comply with the PSD2 directive. They developed a new open banking platform powered by IBM API Connect and IBM Cloud Pak for Integration technology, resulting in reduced integration times and significant cost reductions for their clients. This solution allows banks to quickly adapt to new regulations and services, with approximately 90% of open banking in Bulgaria now relying on IBM integration technology.

title: Cerner could be acquired by Oracle, says WSJ
summary: Oracle is reportedly in talks to acquire health IT giant Cerner Corp. for an estimated $30 billion, which would be Oracle's largest acquisition to date. This move would significantly bolster Oracle's presence in healthcare technology, particularly in cloud computing and AI, following a trend of major tech companies investing heavily in healthcare-focused firms. The potential acquisition comes amidst a challenging year for Cerner, despite its CEO expressing optimism about long-term growth.

title: |Product Liability & Mass Torts Digest
summary: |A Texas District Court has allowed a class-action lawsuit against Apple to proceed after a plaintiff, Robert Franklin, claimed his iPhone 6 exploded and injured him. The court ruled that Franklin had standing to represent a class of iPhone 6 owners who experienced similar issues, despite Apple's arguments against "substantially similar" products and lack of a safer alternative design. While the design defect claim was dismissed with leave to amend, claims for manufacturing defect, market defect, negligence, and certain Texas Deceptive Trade Practices Act claims were allowed to go forward.

title: Intel to invest $7 billion in new plant in Malaysia, creating 9,000 jobs
summary: Intel Chief Executive Pat Gelsinger announced a $7 billion investment to build a new chip-packaging and testing factory in Malaysia, creating over 4,000 Intel jobs and more than 5,000 construction jobs. This expansion aims to address the global semiconductor shortage, which Gelsinger expects to persist into 2023. The new advanced packaging facility is projected to begin production in 2024.

title: The Invesco QQQ Stock Price Is Up 23.7% Since January. Could There Be More Gains?
summary: The Invesco QQQ Trust (NASDAQ: QQQ) has seen its stock price rise 23.7% since January, driven by major tech companies like Apple and Google, despite recent pullbacks. Investors are closely watching the Federal Reserve's monetary policy meeting for potential hawkish policies that could further impact the Nasdaq index and the QQQ ETF. While the ETF is currently in a downtrend, its present stock price may be attractive for a future rally, though a clear upward trend based on EMA crossings is yet to materialize.

title: What Zoom’s $85m class action lawsuit means for data privacy
summary: Zoom has agreed to pay an $85 million settlement in a class action lawsuit alleging it shared user data without consent and falsely claimed end-to-end encryption. This case highlights a broader data privacy movement forcing companies to increase transparency and adjust to stricter regulations. Experts believe the lawsuit serves as a cautionary tale for the digital ecosystem and will prompt other companies to re-evaluate their data protection policies.

title: Go With GINN as High-Margin Companies Remain Trendy
summary: Investors are expected to favor quality, high-margin companies in 2022, a trend supported by the Goldman Sachs Innovate Equity ETF (GINN). GINN tracks companies with robust profitability, strong earnings growth, and effective margin management, aligning with Goldman Sachs' recommendation for clients. Several of GINN's holdings, including Alphabet, Meta Platforms, Apple, Marvell Technology, Mastercard, PayPal, Autodesk, and Etsy, are featured on Goldman's list of high-margin companies.

title: Is Saudi Aramco Stock a Good Buy? • (TADAWUL: 2222)
summary: This article analyzes whether Saudi Aramco stock is a good buy, considering its status as one of the world's largest companies, financial performance, and future outlook. It provides guidance on how to gain exposure to the stock through ETFs, discusses its stock history and value, and presents both bull and bear cases from analysts. The article concludes with a "hold" recommendation due to uncertainties in the global economy and the stock's relatively muted performance despite strong oil prices.

title: 4 Charts on Apple's $3 Trillion Market Cap
summary: Apple Inc. has become the first company to achieve a $3 trillion market capitalization, briefly hitting $182.88 per share. This article highlights the immense scale of Apple's market cap through various comparisons, such as its value exceeding the total market cap of all public companies in Canada. It also discusses Apple's dominance within the U.S. market, making up nearly 22% of all U.S.-domiciled technology companies' total market capitalization.

title: Ford Motor Co. beefs up tech strength with director known for global dominance
summary: Ford Motor Co. has elected John May, CEO of Deere & Co., to its board of directors, a move analysts say underscores Ford's commitment to technology and dominance in electric and autonomous vehicles. May's experience with Deere's technologically advanced agricultural equipment and successful resolution of a recent UAW strike are seen as valuable assets for Ford's own transformation and supply chain management. The appointment expands Ford's board to 15 members, though some observers noted the company's lack of progress in increasing female board representation compared to competitors like GM.

title: Apple Nears $3 Trillion in Market Value. Here’s Some Context
summary: Apple Inc. is close to reaching a $3 trillion market value, needing just a 6% increase in its stock price to hit this milestone. This achievement would make it the first company to reach such a valuation, less than four years after first surpassing $1 trillion. The company's size now rivals the entire German equity market or the U.K. economy.

title: Apple's alleged restriction on workers' Slack use sparks labor complaint
summary: A former Apple employee has filed a complaint with a U.S. labor regulator, alleging that Apple has restricted employees' use of the workplace messaging app Slack. The complaint claims these restrictions hinder workers' ability to engage in protected speech and organizing. This action comes amidst increasing employee activism at Apple regarding issues like pay equity and remote work, with the former employee claiming she was fired after leading such efforts.

title: Apple iPhone 13 Rebates Fail to Deliver for Some Buyers
summary: Some customers are experiencing issues with wireless carriers denying rebates offered to promote new Apple Inc. iPhones, iPads, and Watches. This problem comes years after wireless carriers eliminated deep subsidies for phones, forcing buyers to contend with the full cost of devices. The article also briefly mentions the impact of the omicron variant on Apple and another executive departure.

title: The metaverse needs aggressive regulation
summary: The author, a pioneer in AR/VR technology, argues for aggressive regulation of the metaverse to prevent large corporations from extensive monitoring and manipulation of users. He emphasizes the need to restrict data collection, regulate real-time marketing tactics, and ensure transparency regarding AI-controlled agents and targeted placements. The article warns that without regulation, the metaverse risks becoming an environment where powerful entities exploit user data and emotions for commercial gain.

title: Nasdaq dives over 2% as tech stocks slide at end of volatile week
summary: Wall Street's major indexes, particularly the Nasdaq, experienced a significant decline as tech stocks slid at the end of a volatile week. This downturn was influenced by mixed jobs data, uncertainty surrounding the Omicron coronavirus variant, and the Federal Reserve's policy tightening signals. Major tech companies such as Apple, Meta Platforms, Alphabet, Amazon, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla all saw their shares fall, contributing to the broader market dip.

title: Market Expert: Fall For Quality, Not Just Tech
summary: A market expert suggests investors prioritize high-quality stocks over solely focusing on big tech names. Mark Mahaney of Evercore ISI advocates for investing in "dislocated high-quality" companies with large total addressable markets and strong innovation, rather than just trading tech stocks. The article highlights the FlexShares US Quality Low Volatility Index Fund (QLV) as an example of an ETF that focuses on quality while managing volatility.

title: Market Expert: Fall For Quality, Not Just Tech
summary: An article discussing the importance of balancing tech investments with high-quality stocks. It highlights Mark Mahaney's "dislocated high-quality" (DHQ) investment tenet and introduces the FlexShares US Quality Low Volatility Index Fund (QLV) as a suitable option for investors seeking quality and reduced volatility.

title: U.S. FTC sues to block Nvidia deal to buy Arm
summary: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has sued to block Nvidia Corp's more than $80 billion acquisition of British chip technology provider Arm, citing concerns that the deal would give Nvidia undue control over crucial computing technology and designs. This move complicates an already challenging regulatory path for the acquisition, which has faced opposition from the chip industry and scrutiny from British and European Union regulators. The FTC argues the merger would harm competition, reduce innovation, and lead to higher prices by giving Nvidia the ability and incentive to undermine competitors who rely on Arm's technology.

title: Target's gift card sale returns this weekend with 10% off discount. Here's how to save.
summary: Target is bringing back its annual gift card sale this weekend, offering a 10% discount on purchases up to $500 for Target store gift cards. To access the discount, customers must be members of the free Target Circle loyalty program. The gift cards can be used for personal shopping or as gifts and are redeemable in-store or online.

title: U.S. sues to block Nvidia’s $40-billion chip takeover of Arm
summary: U.S. antitrust officials have sued to block Nvidia's proposed $40-billion acquisition of Arm Ltd., citing concerns that the deal would stifle innovation and undermine competition in the semiconductor industry. The Federal Trade Commission argues that the merger would grant Nvidia excessive control over chip designs widely used across various technologies. The acquisition, initially valued at $40 billion in September 2020, has faced regulatory hurdles globally due to Arm's critical role as a technology licensor to hundreds of companies including Nvidia's rivals.

title: What Stocks Are in QQQ? Rebound Likely, Good Long-Term Pick
summary: The Invesco QQQ Trust Series 1 ETF, which tracks the Nasdaq 100, is a tech-heavy fund that experienced a nosedive following the omicron variant news and inflation concerns in December 2021. Despite this slump, the article suggests that QQQ is likely to recover due to its diverse holdings and past performance, making it a potentially smart long-term investment. The article details the top 20 holdings and the industry breakdown of the ETF.

title: Apple loses a top vehicle engineer to flying-taxi startup Archer Aviation
summary: Michael Schwekutsch, a top vehicle engineer previously with Apple's "Project Titan" electric vehicle initiative, has joined Archer Aviation, a startup focused on building flying taxis. His departure comes as Apple tries to accelerate its self-driving car project, sparking discussions among analysts about Apple Car's potential impact on the broader EV market, particularly on Tesla.

title: Facebook parent grabs another 1M sf in Bay Area
summary: Meta (Facebook's parent company) has leased an additional 1 million square feet of office space in the Bay Area, specifically in Sunnyvale and Burlingame, to reduce employee commute times and support its net-zero carbon emission goal. The lease of four buildings in Sunnyvale, totaling over 700,000 square feet, is considered the largest private-sector office lease in the U.S. this year. This expansion further solidifies Sunnyvale's position as a key office market in Silicon Valley.

title: Apple warns Thai activists "state-sponsored attackers" may have targeted iPhones
summary: Apple Inc. issued alert messages to at least six Thai activists and researchers, warning them that their iPhones may have been targeted by "state-sponsored attackers." This comes after Apple filed a lawsuit against Israeli cyber firm NSO Group for alleged surveillance using its Pegasus spyware. The Thai individuals targeted are perceived as critical of the current Thai government.

title: 20-Year Returns: Monster Eats Apple for Breakfast
summary: Over the past 20 years, Monster Beverage Corporation's stock has outperformed major tech companies like Apple and Amazon, increasing by over 100,000 percent. The company, an early entrant in the energy drink market, has grown significantly, recording $1.4 billion in profit on $4.6 billion in sales in 2020. Monster Beverage is now a dominant player in the energy drink market and has recently been in merger talks with Constellation Brands.

title: Apple sues Israeli firm NSO Group over spyware
summary: Apple Inc. has filed a lawsuit against Israeli firm NSO Group, accusing it of using its Pegasus spyware to hack Apple devices and enable human rights abuses. This legal action follows previous revelations about Pegasus being used against journalists and activists, and comes after WhatsApp's successful lawsuit against NSO and US sanctions against the company. Apple is seeking financial compensation and a permanent ban on NSO from using its servers and devices, pledging to contribute damages from the lawsuit to groups fighting cyber-surveillance.

title: Apple sues company known for hacking iPhones on behalf of governments
summary: Apple has filed a lawsuit against NSO Group, an Israeli firm that develops software to hack iPhones, alleging that the company weaponizes powerful state-sponsored spyware against innocent users. Apple seeks a permanent injunction to prevent NSO Group from using its software, services, or devices and is seeking damages exceeding $75,000. Additionally, Apple will donate $10 million and any lawsuit damages to organizations combating digital surveillance, while also pledging to inform iPhone users targeted by Pegasus malware.

title: Amazon and Apple handed $225 million in Italian antitrust fines
summary: Italy's antitrust authority has fined Amazon and Apple a total of more than 200 million euros ($225 million) for alleged anti-competitive cooperation. The fines stem from a 2018 agreement that restricted the sale of Apple and Beats products on Amazon.it to only selected resellers, violating EU rules and impacting price competition. Both companies deny wrongdoing and plan to appeal the decision.

title: Apple posts internal memo affirming employees' right to discuss pay
summary: Apple has issued an internal memo affirming employees' right to discuss their wages, hours, and working conditions, a significant shift for the company following months of employee advocacy. This move comes after workers pushed for greater transparency regarding pay equity and faced restrictions on discussing these topics internally. The memo acknowledges rights protected under the National Labor Relations Act and is seen as a victory for Apple organizers who have filed unfair labor practice charges against the company.

title: How the company that makes glass for your iPhone produces vials for Covid vaccines
summary: Corning, known for Gorilla Glass and cookware, has rapidly expanded its pharmaceuticals business. The company opened a new factory in Durham, North Carolina, capable of producing 500 million glass vials annually for vaccines and drugs, supported by $204 million in federal funding from Operation Warp Speed. Corning also unveiled Velocity Vials, engineered to speed up manufacturing, which are already being utilized by pharmaceutical manufacturer Catalent.

title: Live Nation, Apple, Travis Scott Sued for $2 Billion Over Astroworld Disaster
summary: Live Nation, Apple Inc., and Travis Scott are being sued for $2 billion by 282 concertgoers who claim they were injured during the Astroworld festival. The lawsuit, filed in Houston, alleges that the crowd of 50,000 people was "incited into a frenzy," leading to 10 deaths and hundreds of injuries. The complaint is an amendment to an earlier lawsuit and is the largest one filed to date regarding the tragic event.

title: Exclusive first look inside Corning's new pharmaceutical vial factory
summary: CNBC got an exclusive look inside Corning's new pharmaceutical vial factory in Durham, North Carolina, which has the capacity to produce 500 million glass vials annually. This facility, built with partial funding from Operation Warp Speed, uses Gorilla Glass technology for enhanced durability and storage capabilities, crucial for Covid-19 vaccines. Corning CEO Wendell Weeks sees billions of dollars in opportunity for the company's pharmaceutical business.

title: Apple announces Self Service Repair
summary: Apple announced Self Service Repair, allowing customers access to genuine Apple parts, tools, and manuals for self-repairs. Initially available for iPhone 12 and iPhone 13 lineups in the US in early 2022, with plans to expand to Mac computers and other countries. This program provides an additional option for customers comfortable with DIY repairs, alongside Apple's existing network of authorized service providers.

title: Qualcomm forecasts post-Apple sales growth, shares hit all-time high
summary: Qualcomm Inc. expects its chip sales to Apple Inc. to significantly decrease in the coming years as Apple develops its own modem chips. However, Qualcomm anticipates robust growth in other sectors like autonomous cars, the internet of things, and virtual reality headsets, which led to its shares hitting a record high. The company projects substantial revenue increases from automotive and IoT divisions, offsetting the expected decline from Apple.

title: Moviegoers Can Now Use Bitcoin, Ether at AMC Theatres
summary: AMC Theatres now accepts Bitcoin, Ether, and several other cryptocurrencies and digital payment platforms for movie tickets, aiming to attract crypto-savvy customers. This move highlights the growing acceptance of digital currencies in mainstream business, creating new opportunities for exchange-traded funds (ETFs) that offer exposure to cryptocurrency or blockchain technology. Investors can gain exposure through ETFs like Amplify Transformational Data Sharing ETF (BLOK) for blockchain or by investing in companies like AMC via the SoFi Social 50 ETF (SFYF).

title: Extended Warranty Revenue Trends, 11 November 2021
summary: This article analyzes extended warranty revenue trends through the financial data of four key companies: Assurant Inc., Frontdoor Inc., Lowe's Companies Inc., and Apple Inc. It suggests that 2020 and 2021 have been strong years for the product protection industry, despite initial pandemic lockdowns. The report details revenue and profit growth for these companies' respective extended warranty programs, concluding that the industry experienced no recession and is breaking records for growth and profitability.

title: 5 Charts on General Electric's Fall From Grace
summary: This article details General Electric's significant decline in value over the past two decades, from once being the most valuable company globally to its current 75th position in the U.S. stock market. It attributes GE's fall to a deterioration of culture, poor capital allocation decisions, and an over-reliance on its financial unit. The article discusses GE's recent decision to split into three companies (aviation, healthcare, and energy), a move applauded by analysts and seen as a potential catalyst for closing the persistent price/value gap for the stock.

title: Apple's original computer fetches $400,000 at US auction
summary: An original Apple-1 computer, built by Steve Wozniak and Steve Jobs in 1976, was sold for $400,000 at a US auction.
