The rare, functioning computer with a Hawaiian koa wood case is one of only 200 made and had only two previous owners. This model is considered a "holy grail" for vintage electronics collectors, though it wasn't the highest-selling Apple-1 to date.

title: Google-owner Alphabet breaches $2 trillion market cap, joins Apple and Microsoft
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc., reached a $2 trillion market capitalization for the first time, driven by increased digital ad spending and growth in its cloud business. This achievement places Alphabet alongside Apple and Microsoft in the exclusive $2 trillion club. The company reported a record third quarter in 2021 with $65.1 billion in earnings.

title: Salesforce CEO Benioff invests in search engine startup You.com
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff has invested $20 million in You.com, a startup aiming to challenge Google's dominance in search with a more customizable and privacy-focused engine. Benioff transferred ownership of the You.com domain name, which he had owned since the 1990s, to the startup. You.com, founded by former Salesforce AI scientists, plans to differentiate itself by not tracking users or selling "privacy-invasive ads," instead focusing on revenue from transactions and helping publishers generate ad revenue.

title: An original Apple-1 computer sells for $400,000
summary: An original Apple-1 computer, one of only 200 designed by Steve Wozniak and Steve Jobs, was sold for $400,000 at auction. The computer, known as the "Chaffey College" Apple-1, was initially sold for $666.66 in 1976 and represents a significant piece of personal computing history. Its koa wood case is one of only six known to exist, making it a rare collector's item.

title: Google’s parent Alphabet breaches $2 trillion in market value
authors: Katrina Lewis and Nico Grant and Bloomberg
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc., reached a $2 trillion market valuation for the first time, driven by strong growth in digital advertising and its cloud business. This puts Alphabet in an exclusive club with Apple Inc. and Microsoft Corp., with analysts remaining optimistic about its future growth due to a cheaper valuation and increasing cloud adoption.

title: Adobe issued a DMCA request to remove Clean Flash, an open source project that continued to support Flash
summary: Adobe has issued a DMCA request to shut down the "Clean Flash" open-source project, which aimed to continue supporting Adobe Flash Player worldwide after its official end-of-life on December 31, 2020. While Adobe officially stopped global distribution of Flash, it still supports the technology in China and for businesses, leading Clean Flash to provide a working and updated version independently. This move highlights ongoing debate within the developer community about the preservation of Flash content versus moving entirely to open standards like HTML5.

title: The Future of Netflix’s Gaming Service Rests With Apple’s App Store Rules
summary: Netflix's ambitious plans for its gaming service, aimed at customer retention and acquisition, face a significant hurdle: Apple's App Store rules. While Netflix's gaming offering is currently limited, particularly on Android, its expansion on iOS could be severely constrained by Apple's policies. This highlights a potential conflict between Netflix's strategic growth in gaming and Apple's control over its ecosystem.

title: ‘Business needs a noble purpose and a human-centric approach — these core principles revived Best Buy’
summary: Hubert Joly, former CEO of Best Buy, discusses how a human-centric approach and noble purpose revived the company, leading its share price to rise 11-fold. He emphasizes that putting people at the center and embracing all stakeholders is crucial for businesses today, especially in navigating challenges like the pandemic and climate change. Joly argues that the "Milton Friedman doctrine" of profit-first is outdated and highlights companies like Microsoft, Ralph Lauren, and Unilever as examples of successful human-centric models.

title: How To Target Your Audience Without Third-Party Cookie Data
summary: This article explores the impending demise of third-party cookies by late 2023 and its implications for digital advertising. It discusses how advertisers will face challenges in targeting ads and measuring performance, and outlines three potential scenarios for digital ad targeting: walled gardens, a consent economy, and identity innovation. The article also provides strategies for marketers to adapt, focusing on first-party data, direct publisher relationships, and contextual advertising.

title: Monthly Market Wrap - October 2021
summary: The October 2021 market wrap highlights a month of economic observations including rising inflation, the Federal Reserve's anticipated tapering, and varied performance across domestic and international equities. It also covers positive trends in alternative investments and the increasing integration of ESG factors into investment strategies. The report details specific market indices and economic indicators, providing a comprehensive overview of the financial landscape during the month.

title: Netflix Adds Mobile Games to Its App for Some Users
summary: Netflix has begun rolling out mobile games to its app for Android users, including titles based on its popular show "Stranger Things." This move is part of the streaming company's strategy to attract new subscribers and increase engagement among current users. Games are expected to become available for Apple iOS devices in the coming months.

title: Another Apple Worker Says the Company Retaliated Against Her (Published 2021)
summary: Janneke Parrish, a former Apple Maps program manager and leader of the #AppleToo activist movement, has filed a complaint with the National Labor Relations Board, alleging Apple fired her in retaliation for her activism. This escalation marks a growing conflict between Apple and some of its employees who have been vocal about workplace concerns. The situation signals a notable shift for Apple, which has historically avoided the kind of worker unrest observed at other major tech companies.

title: Apple adds suppliers to clean-energy pledge, including more chip firms
summary: Apple announced that 175 of its suppliers have committed to using clean energy for their work, bringing over 9 gigawatts of clean energy to power grids, as part of its goal to achieve a carbon-neutral supply chain by 2030. This expansion includes key chip manufacturers like SK Hynix Inc and STMicroelectronics, adding to previous commitments from major suppliers like Foxconn and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. Apple is also funding 10 smaller renewable energy projects in under-resourced communities globally.

title: Apple cuts iPad production to feed chips to iPhone 13 -Nikkei
summary: Apple has reduced its iPad production by 50% for the past two months to reallocate components to the iPhone 13, according to Nikkei. This move highlights the impact of the global chip supply crunch on Apple, despite its strong purchasing power and supplier agreements. The company is prioritizing iPhone 13 production due to forecasted stronger demand as Western markets recover from the pandemic and increased demand in China.

title: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger’s “insane” plan to restore the company’s glory days
summary: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger is implementing an "insane" and ambitious plan to regain the company's market leadership. This involves massive capital expenditures between $25 billion and $28 billion annually, along with $15 billion in R&D, to improve technology and capacity, especially in foundry business. The strategy aims for performance parity by 2024 and industry leadership by 2025, a bold move given Intel's recent struggles against competitors like Apple and ARM-based chips.

title: Tesla's 'Sentry Mode' now offers live view of car to owner
summary: Tesla has released a new software update for its Sentry Mode, allowing owners to remotely view their car's surroundings via a live camera feed on iOS devices. This feature, called Sentry Mode Live Camera Access, requires an active Premium Connectivity subscription for full functionality. The company emphasizes that the live camera feed is end-to-end encrypted and inaccessible by Tesla.

title: Apple and Amazon Stock Dives Set to Erase $200 Billion in Value
summary: Apple (AAPL) and Amazon (AMZN) are expected to see their combined market valuation drop by over $200 billion when markets open Friday after both companies reported disappointing earnings. Apple's revenue missed expectations due to supply constraints, while Amazon's revenue forecast was below consensus and it warned of high costs impacting holiday quarter profits.

title: Apple charges forward to 2030 carbon neutral goal, adding 9 gigawatts of clean power and doubling supplier commitments
summary: Apple has significantly advanced its 2030 carbon neutral goal, doubling the number of suppliers committed to 100 percent clean energy to 175. This initiative is expected to bring online over 9 gigawatts of clean power and avoid more than 18 million metric tons of CO2e annually. Additionally, Apple is supporting 10 new "Power for Impact" projects globally to bring clean energy solutions to under-resourced communities and reduce its carbon footprint.

title: Apple’s New AirPods Are Pandemic-Proof
summary: The review highlights the new Apple AirPods 3, emphasizing that their shorter stems make them "pandemic-proof" by not interfering with face mask loops, solving a common frustration. While also noting improved sound and battery life, the author positions the mask compatibility as the most significant enhancement. The article also discusses spatial audio, battery life, and sweat resistance, concluding with advice on which AirPods model to consider based on user needs.

title: Target is adding Apple mini-shops to 3 more Minnesota stores
summary: Target Corp. is expanding its partnership with Apple Inc., adding three new mini-shops within its Minnesota stores. This move more than doubles the number of Apple mini-shops already present in Target locations. This expansion is part of a broader strategy to integrate specialized retail experiences within Target stores.

title: Warren Buffett, Berkshire Hit $9 Billion Gain on Amex Stock This Year
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has seen its investment in American Express (Amex) increase by $9 billion this year, bringing its total unrealized gain on the stock to $26 billion. Berkshire owns 19% of Amex, a position it has held since 1998, having only invested $1.3 billion initially. Amex is the third-largest holding in Berkshire's US stock portfolio, following Apple and Bank of America.

title: On-device Panoptic Segmentation for Camera Using Transformers
summary: This article details Apple's HyperDETR, an on-device panoptic segmentation model for its Camera app. Built on Transformers, HyperDETR efficiently segments images for features like Portrait Mode and Photographic Styles without significant battery drain. The paper highlights the model's architecture, training, and compression techniques, making it suitable for resource-constrained mobile environments.

title: Megahit "Squid Game" puts focus squarely on Netflix's overseas growth
summary: The success of "Squid Game" is prompting investors to focus on Netflix's international content strategy as a key driver for subscriber growth, especially in emerging markets, after a period of slowing additions. Analysts anticipate the megahit will boost subscriber numbers beyond estimates for the third quarter and impact the next three months. The article also highlights increased competition in the streaming market and Netflix's financial fundamentals.

title: Apple unveils game-changing MacBook Pro
summary: Apple has unveiled a completely reimagined MacBook Pro powered by the new M1 Pro and M1 Max chips, available in 14- and 16-inch models. These new laptops offer extraordinary performance, unprecedented battery life, and advanced features like a Liquid Retina XDR display, improved camera and audio systems, and extensive connectivity, marking a significant leap for professional users. The MacBooks are designed for various professionals, offer remarkable power efficiency, and feature an environmentally conscious design with recycled materials.

title: Alibaba said to be launching a new home-grown chip this week
summary: Alibaba Group Holding is set to launch a server chip this week based on Arm Holdings technology, joining other Chinese tech giants in semiconductor development. The chip’s design process concluded mid-year and it will be minted using the 5-nanometre process, showcasing China's increasing investment in chip design due to lower capital requirements. Alibaba's previous chip endeavors include Hanguang 800 and XuanTie 910.

title: Check out Cipher Mining Equity Warrant Exp 26th Aug 2026's stock price (CIFRW) in real time
summary: This article provides real-time stock information for Cipher Mining Equity Warrant Exp 26th Aug 2026 (CIFRW), including its current price, historical performance metrics, key financial stats, and recent news. It highlights the company's profile as an industrial-scale data center construction and operations firm focused on bitcoin mining and high-performance computing, along with insights from analyst calls.

title: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger hopes to win back Apple by outcompeting it
summary: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger expressed his hope to regain Apple as a customer, acknowledging that Intel will need to outperform Apple to achieve this. Gelsinger stated that he doesn't blame Apple for choosing to produce its own chips over using Intel's. He emphasized the necessity of Intel's products being superior to Apple's.

title: Tile Compatibility With Android™ and Apple® iOS Devices | Tile
summary: This article discusses the compatibility of Tile trackers with both Android and Apple iOS devices. It highlights that Tile works seamlessly across both operating systems, allowing users to track their belongings regardless of their phone's brand. The article also touches upon the core functionalities of Tile, such as finding misplaced items, and emphasizes its cross-platform accessibility.

title: Zepp Health banks on new smartwatches for growth
summary: Zepp Health, formerly Huami Corp, is banking on its new smartwatch releases, the Amazfit GTR 3 and GTS 3 series, to drive growth. The company has seen significant global expansion, becoming the fourth-largest smartwatch vendor by shipments in Q1. Zepp Health is investing in R&D and incorporating advanced health-tracking features into its devices to compete in the growing smartwatch market.

title: Apple likely to cut iPhone 13 production due to chip crunch – Bloomberg News
summary: Apple Inc. is reportedly planning to slash its iPhone 13 production target by as many as 10 million units due to the ongoing global chip shortage, according to Bloomberg News. Chip suppliers like Broadcom Inc. and Texas Instruments are struggling to meet demand, impacting Apple's ability to produce the anticipated 90 million units by year-end. Despite this, some analysts believe Apple is handling the supply crunch better than competitors and maintain healthy sales forecasts for the iPhone 13.

title: Qualcomm Increases Share Buyback Plan by $10B
summary: Qualcomm (QCOM) has approved a new $10 billion stock repurchase program, complementing an existing plan with $0.9 billion remaining. This move led to a 1.3% increase in shares during extended trading. Wells Fargo analyst Gary Mobley maintained a Hold rating but adjusted the price target to $138.

title: How ‘Squid Game’ reveals the flaw in Netflix’s products strategy
summary: Netflix's new partnership with Walmart for a digital storefront, the Netflix Hub, is criticized for its delayed inclusion of merchandise from the hugely popular show "Squid Game." While Netflix aims to diversify revenue through licensed products, the article highlights that fans are more interested in "real" items from the show, like Vans sneakers and tracksuits, which are experiencing massive sales spikes independently, revealing a flaw in Netflix's product strategy. The company's own official merchandise for "Squid Game" is described as limited and generic, not capitalizing on the immediate demand for authentic-looking items from the show.

title: Apple to slash iPhone 13 production on chip shortages
summary: Apple is expected to cut its projected iPhone 13 production targets for 2021 by up to 10 million units due to prolonged chip shortages affecting key suppliers like Broadcom Inc. and Texas Instruments Inc. This shortage is impacting Apple's ability to deliver new iPhone 13 Pro and Pro Max models, with current orders facing significant shipping delays. Despite Apple's strong buying power, the global chip shortage, exacerbated by the pandemic and an energy crisis in China, is affecting its production of other products as well, including the Apple Watch Series 7.

title: Expedia CTO Rathi Murthy is helping the company simplify
summary: Rathi Murthy, who took over as Chief Technology Officer at Expedia Group in May 2021, is focusing on simplifying the company's technology infrastructure. Murthy brings experience from previous roles at Gap and Verizon to her new position at the Seattle-based travel company. This move is part of the company's efforts to streamline operations.

title: EU to investigate Nvidia's $54 bln ARM bid after remedies fall short - sources
summary: The EU is expected to launch an extended antitrust investigation into Nvidia's $54 billion bid for British chip designer ARM. This comes after remedies offered by Nvidia last week failed to address competition concerns, marking a second setback for the company after a similar warning from Britain's antitrust agency. The European Commission is scheduled to end its preliminary review on October 27, initiating a four-month investigation.

title: Understanding the Buzz Around the BUZZ ETF
summary: The article discusses the VanEck Vectors Social Sentiment ETF (BUZZ), which debuted in March 2021 and capitalizes on the "meme stock" phenomenon. It examines BUZZ's methodology, noting that its longer lookback period means it doesn't solely focus on highly speculative meme stocks like GameStop and AMC. Instead, BUZZ's portfolio includes quality names like AMD, Apple, Nvidia, and Pfizer, and exhibits low single-stock risk.

title: ClixTV Launches To Help Streamers Find Something To Watch
summary: ClixTV has launched as a new streaming service designed to help viewers find content across various top subscription services, offering its own short- and long-form programming, trailers, and e-commerce opportunities. Founded by industry veterans Edward Sullivan (CEO), Stacy Jolna (CMO), and Patricia Sullivan (CCO), ClixTV aims to simplify the content search experience for consumers and provide benefits for creators, distributors, and advertisers. The platform is available on multiple devices and services including Roku, Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, and iOS/Android.

title: It’s Time for the Apple Watch to Break Free From the iPhone
summary: This article argues that it is time for the Apple Watch to become more independent from the iPhone. It suggests Apple should allow the Apple Watch Series 7 and future models to function more autonomously. The piece also briefly mentions Apple's ambitions in car controls and an update on the Epic Games lawsuit.

title: Paul Marshall and Ian Wace’s Stock Picks: Biogen Inc (BIIB), Apple Inc (AAPL) and More
summary: This article details the top stock picks of hedge fund managers Paul Marshall and Ian Wace, based on their Q2 2021 holdings. It highlights a selection of companies including Biogen Inc (BIIB), Apple Inc (AAPL), Zoetis Inc. (ZTS), ViacomCBS Inc. (VIAC), and Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (TMO), providing details on their stake value, company background, and recent analyst ratings or news. The piece also explains the investment philosophy and background of Marshall Wace LLP.

title: Discover Equal Weight Benefits With RSP
summary: This article discusses the benefits of equal weight ETFs, using the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP) as a prime example. It explains how equal weighting offers diversification beyond cap-weighted funds and benefits from mean-reversion, despite critics associating its outperformance with size and value factors. The article highlights RSP's long-term outperformance potential and its role in true diversification by preventing a few mega-cap stocks from dominating the index.

title: Nvidia offers EU concessions over $54 billion Arm deal
summary: Nvidia has offered concessions to the EU antitrust regulator regarding its $54 billion acquisition of British chip designer Arm. The deal has raised concerns within the semiconductor industry about Arm's neutrality as a technology supplier. The EU will now seek feedback before deciding whether to approve the deal, demand more concessions, or open a formal investigation.

title: At a $2 Trillion Market Value, Saudi Aramco Races Apple for Most Valuable Company
summary: Saudi Aramco is nearing Apple Inc.'s market valuation, reaching $2 trillion due to surging energy prices, while Apple's value stands at $2.3 trillion. This shift reflects broader economic changes, with increasing oil demand benefiting Aramco and rising bond yields impacting tech stocks like Apple. Analysts suggest oil prices could climb further, potentially pushing Aramco's valuation even higher.

title: Ansys and Apple Develop the First Cloud-based RF Safety Testing Simulation Solution for MagSafe module MFi Developers
summary: Ansys and Apple have partnered to create the first cloud-based RF safety testing simulation solution for MagSafe module MFi developers. This new Ansys solution significantly reduces costs and accelerates the certification process for Made For iPhone (MFi) MagSafe module technology by eliminating the need for physical prototypes and expensive RF safety certification software. The platform uses Ansys' HFSS electromagnetic solver, offering a streamlined, intuitive, and automated process for SAR certification, helping developers bring safe and reliable products to market more quickly.

title: GINN's Got the Goods of Quality Disruptive Companies
summary: The article highlights the Goldman Sachs Innovate Equity ETF (GINN) as a strong investment opportunity, particularly for those seeking exposure to high-quality, disruptive growth companies. Despite the S&P 500 Technology Index's flat performance in the third quarter, GINN focuses on larger, mature yet innovative companies with high return on equity (ROE), such as Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. The fund's significant allocation to technology and healthcare sectors, combined with its emphasis on quality traits and R&D-focused companies, positions it well for continued upside.

title: INSIGHTS | Conservative investors are pairing portfolio with principles
summary: Tom Carter, a mutual fund executive, has launched the American Conservative Values ETF to allow conservative investors to align their portfolios with their principles, avoiding "woke" companies. The fund, which began in October and already manages over $28 million, aims to provide an option for individuals who wish to invest in companies that share their conservative values rather than those that engage in social and racial justice advocacy. This initiative reflects a broader movement where conservatives are using economic choices to "fight back" against companies perceived as aligning with liberal politics.

title: Jabil expects to hit over $8B in net revenue in Q1 of 2022
summary: Jabil Inc. (NYSE: JBL) reported strong financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year, with net revenue of $7.4 billion and $29.3 billion respectively, despite supply chain challenges. Looking ahead to Q1 2022, the company projects net revenue between $8 billion and $8.6 billion, driven by its diversified business model and opportunities in vehicle electrification, connected healthcare, and infrastructure development. Jabil continues to work with major clients such as Amazon, Tesla, Apple, and Johnson & Johnson.

title: Specifications of Personal Computers Over Time
summary: This article traces the evolution of personal computer specifications over 50 years, from the 1971 Kenbak-1 to modern HP Pavilion models. It highlights significant advancements in RAM and processing speed, and discusses key PC specifications like processor speed and RAM, explaining their importance and upgradeability. An infographic details spec changes for popular computers through the years.

title: Everything you need to know about Apple Harvest Day 2021 as the festival returns to Dover
summary: Apple Harvest Day is returning to downtown Dover, New Hampshire on Saturday, October 2, 2021, after being canceled as an in-person event in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The 37th annual festival will feature over 250 vendors, food courts, live entertainment on two stages, kids' activities including a KidZone and Auto Alley, and the traditional Apple Harvest Day 5K race and apple pie contest. Shuttle parking will be available for attendees.

title: RIM delays new BlackBerry launch; sales crumble
summary: Research In Motion Ltd (RIM) has delayed the launch of its next-generation BlackBerry phones until early 2013, a significant setback for the company facing crumbling sales, a deeper-than-expected quarterly operating loss, and deep job cuts. The delay, coupled with a 30% workforce reduction and mounting financial pressure, signals a potential terminal decline for the once-dominant technology firm. Analysts are concerned about RIM's survival as it misses crucial shopping periods and struggles to compete with Apple and Android.

title: Netflix VP Of Communications Richard Siklos Leaves The Company
summary: Richard Siklos, Netflix's VP of communications since 2017, has announced his departure from the streaming giant. His exit follows other executive changes at Netflix, which has seen significant growth in recent years and has maintained its leadership in the streaming market despite increased competition. Siklos previously held a senior communications role at Time Warner and had a notable career as a journalist specializing in the media business.

title: Apple iPhone 13 tests whether deals, cameras will spur upgrades
summary: Apple released its iPhone 13 lineup, featuring new camera technology and enhanced battery life, to assess if these improvements combined with aggressive carrier deals will drive upgrades despite a lack of dramatic redesign. U.S. carriers like Verizon, AT&T, and T-Mobile are offering significant incentives, sometimes even making the iPhone 13 Pro free with trade-ins, which is already leading to backlogs in online orders for the new devices. This launch kicks off a busy holiday season for Apple, with other new products like a redesigned iPad mini and upcoming MacBook Pros and AirPods also in the pipeline.

title: Apple threatened Facebook ban over slavery posts on Instagram
summary: Apple threatened to remove Facebook's products from its App Store in 2019 after a BBC investigation revealed domestic "slaves" were being sold on apps, including Instagram. The Wall Street Journal's "Facebook Files" revealed Facebook took limited action until Apple's threat, despite internal reports showing knowledge of the online slave trade prior to the BBC's inquiry. Following the BBC report and Apple's intervention, Facebook banned hashtags, removed accounts, and developed technology to proactively address content related to domestic servitude.

title: Apple bans Fortnite from App Store until appeals are exhausted
summary: Apple has informed Epic Games that Fortnite will remain banned from its App Store until all appeals in their legal dispute are exhausted, a process that Epic CEO Tim Sweeney estimates could take five years. This decision comes after a recent court ruling largely favored Apple, despite requiring the company to allow developers to direct users to alternative payment systems. Epic had sought reinstatement of its developer account, promising to adhere to Apple's guidelines, but Apple cited Epic's past "duplicitous conduct" and Sweeney's critical remarks post-ruling as reasons for refusal.

title: BSX publishes market data to Pyth Network
summary: The Bermuda Stock Exchange (BSX) has started publishing MIAX Pearl Equities market data for ten US companies to the Pyth Network, a decentralized financial market data distribution platform. This initiative marks BSX's first step in providing high-fidelity data to the blockchain industry via the Solana network, with plans to expand the data breadth. The included companies are major US firms like Apple, Amazon, and Tesla, marking a significant development for DeFi markets.

title: BSX Begins Publishing MIAX Pearl Equities
summary: The Bermuda Stock Exchange (BSX), a subsidiary of Miami International Holdings, Inc., has started publishing MIAX Pearl Equities market data for 10 actively traded U.S. companies to the Pyth Network. This marks BSX's first initiative to provide high-fidelity data to the Pyth Network, contributing U.S. equities exchange market data to support DeFi markets. The initial companies include Apple, Amazon, Google, Netflix, and Tesla.

title: Kontakt.io Launches Nano Tag, the World's Smallest Affordable, Disposable & Wearable BLE Tag
summary: Kontakt.io Inc. has launched the Nano Tag, hailed as the world's smallest affordable, disposable, and wearable BLE tag. This innovation aims to address worker safety and patient/visitor experience in healthcare, hospitality, and events by offering a cost-effective and environmentally friendly solution. The Nano Tag features a compact design, a non-toxic battery, Bluetooth 5.0 technology, and is available for purchase through various channels starting from $4.99 unit price.

title: Is a stock market correction on the horizon?
summary: The S&P 500 has seen a recent dip, leading analysts to narrow predictions for the U.S. equity market. While tech stocks may face challenges due to Fed policy and rising interest rates, other sectors like energy and small-caps are showing potential. Despite concerns, corrections are normal, and many analysts remain bullish on long-term market growth, suggesting current dips could be buying opportunities.

title: Goldman Sachs to acquire GreenSky for $2.24 billion
summary: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has agreed to acquire GreenSky Inc. for approximately $2.24 billion, integrating the fintech company into its Marcus consumer-banking platform. This acquisition will add GreenSky's payment plan services for home-improvement and healthcare needs, along with its network of over 10,000 merchants. The deal aims to expand Goldman's consumer-banking offerings and reach new customers through merchant partnerships.

title: An Extremely Simple 3 ETF Portfolio to Consider
summary: This article proposes a simple three-ETF portfolio for long-term investors who prefer not to engage in individual stock analysis. The suggested ETFs are the Vanguard Total Stock Market Index Fund (VTI), the Vanguard FTSE All-World ex-US Index Fund ETF Shares (VEU), and the Vanguard Total Bond Market Index Fund ETF Shares (BND). The author highlights VTI's objective to track the US stock market and details its top holdings, current price, and expense ratio.

title: A free iPhone 13? Wireless carriers’ subsidies could make it happen, with some catches
summary: Wireless carriers like AT&T, Verizon, and T-Mobile are once again offering significant discounts, potentially even a free iPhone 13, to attract new customers. This strategy, which resumed last year, aims to leverage the appeal of Apple’s new smartphones to shore up customer bases as 5G network access expands. While the iPhone 13 lineup offers few new features, the aggressive carrier subsidies are expected to drive sales.

title: Apple reveals Apple Watch Series 7, featuring the largest, most advanced display
summary: Apple announced the Apple Watch Series 7, featuring a reengineered Always-On Retina display with significantly more screen area and thinner borders, making it the largest and most advanced display ever. The new series boasts enhanced durability, faster charging, new aluminum case colors, and runs on watchOS 8. It also introduces new workout types, improved fall detection for cycling, and expands Apple Fitness+ to more countries.

title: Apple’s Newest iPhone Comes With a $0 Price Tag Again at AT&T
summary: AT&T (T) is offering a new iPhone 13 Pro for free to new and existing customers with qualifying trade-ins and unlimited data plans, a deal valued at up to $1,000. This move marks a second year of giveaways for the carrier, aiming to extend subscriber growth and gain market share following the debut of Apple Inc.'s (AAPL) newest phones. T-Mobile US Inc. and Verizon Communications Inc. are also offering similar competitive deals, matching or providing substantial credits towards the new iPhone 13 models.

title: Goldman Sachs appoints Coleman as new CFO, replacing Scherr
summary: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. announced that Denis Coleman will replace Stephen Scherr as Chief Financial Officer at year-end. Coleman, currently co-head of the global financing group, will assume the deputy CFO role immediately. Scherr, who has been CFO since November 2018, will remain until the end of the year and formally retire at the end of January.

title: Apple reveals iPhone 13 lineup, iPad Mini price increase and larger Apple Watch
summary: Apple Inc. unveiled its new lineup of devices for the holiday shopping season, including the iPhone 13, a more expensive iPad Mini, and a new Apple Watch with a larger screen. The announcement comes as the most valuable U.S. public company aims to focus on the busy holiday period rather than its ongoing regulatory challenges. These annual product reveals typically precede the holiday shopping frenzy.

title: Apple fixes flaw exploited by Israeli firm’s Pegasus spyware
authors: Davide Scigliuzzo and William Turton and Bloomberg
summary: Apple has released software updates to patch a critical security flaw in its Messages app that was reportedly exploited by NSO Group's Pegasus spyware. This "zero-click" vulnerability allowed hackers to access devices without user interaction, affecting iPhones, iPads, Macs, and Apple Watches. The flaw was discovered by Citizen Lab, which stated it was used to target a Saudi activist's device.

title: How Navi's FoF on Vanguard US Total Stock Market ETF could add value to your portfolio
summary: Navi Mutual Fund has filed for a new Fund of Fund (FoF) that will invest in the Vanguard Total Stock Market Index Fund ETF (VTI), a passively managed US-based ETF with a very low expense ratio. This FoF will allow Indian investors to access the broad US equity market, including companies typically unavailable in India, potentially adding value due to low correlation with the Indian market. However, investors should be aware of debt fund taxation rules for international funds.

title: Secret to Apple’s iPhone Sales Boom: Big 5G Deals From Wireless Carriers
summary: Apple's iPhone sales have seen a boom since the introduction of 5G-capable models, largely driven by aggressive promotional offers from wireless carriers. Major carriers like Verizon, AT&T, and T-Mobile have implemented substantial subsidies to retain customers and encourage upgrades to their 5G services. As Apple prepares to unveil new 5G iPhones, a key question remains about the sustainability of these carrier incentives in fueling iPhone sales.

title: Renate Nyborg becomes Tinder’s first female CEO
summary: Match Group Inc. has appointed Renate Nyborg as the new chief executive officer of Tinder, making her the dating app's first female CEO since its inception in 2012. Nyborg, who previously led Tinder's operations in Europe, Middle East, and Africa, will succeed Jim Lanzone. Her appointment is effective September 27 and she will report to Match CEO Shar Dubey.

title: Apple can’t force developers to use its in-app payment system, federal judge rules
summary: A federal judge ruled that Apple Inc. can no longer compel developers to use its in-app payment system, allowing them to bypass commission fees of 15% to 30%. This decision, stemming from the Epic Games Inc. case, could significantly alter how apps are distributed by dominant online platforms like Apple, Alphabet Inc. (Google), and Amazon.com Inc. However, the ruling stopped short of declaring Apple an antitrust monopolist.

title: PayPal deepens its buy-now-pay-later push with acquisition of Japan’s Paidy for $2.7 billion
summary: PayPal has announced its acquisition of Japanese buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) startup Paidy for 300 billion yen ($2.7 billion) to strengthen its presence in the BNPL market, particularly in Japan. Paidy allows consumers to make online purchases and pay in installments at convenience stores, catering to Japan's cash-centric economy. This acquisition follows other significant BNPL deals in the industry, highlighting the growing global trend of flexible payment options.

title: Stryker buys Gauss Surgical for its AI tech that tracks blood loss during childbirth
summary: Stryker has acquired Gauss Surgical for its AI-powered Triton system, which tracks blood loss during surgery and childbirth to help prevent postpartum hemorrhaging. The Triton system uses an iPhone app and computer vision to measure blood loss from sponges, towels, and fluid canisters, alerting caregivers to dangerous situations. Following the acquisition, Gauss's home diagnostic efforts, including a smartphone-paired rapid antigen test for COVID-19, will be spun off into a new separate company called Exa Health.

title: Stryker Acquires Med Device Company Gauss Surgical
summary: Stryker announced its acquisition of Gauss Surgical, a medical device company known for its AI-enabled Triton platform that monitors blood loss during surgery. The Triton system utilizes artificial intelligence and mobile technology to provide real-time, accurate blood loss measurements, which has been shown to improve maternal and surgical care by enabling earlier recognition and intervention of hemorrhage. Financial terms of the acquisition were not disclosed.

title: Lennox announces new integration of its iComfort thermostat
summary: Lennox has expanded the compatibility of its iComfort thermostats to integrate with various smart home automation platforms, including premium systems like Control4 and popular virtual assistants such as Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit, Google Assistant, and IFTTT. This integration allows users to manage their Lennox heating and cooling systems through a wider range of smart home devices, offering enhanced convenience and control over their indoor environment. Control4 customers with Lennox HVAC systems and iComfort S30, E30, or M30 thermostats can request integration through their dealer, enabling centralized control from their smart home system.

title: Alphabet, Tesla and Amazon are among the most favourite stocks held by US-focused mutual funds. Here are top 10 stocks
summary: This article identifies Alphabet, Tesla, and Amazon as top stock holdings among U.S.-focused mutual funds available to Indian investors. It details 10 such mutual funds, highlighting their investment strategies, underlying assets, and historical performance. The funds provide Indian investors exposure to leading US companies and geographical diversification.

title: Toll Brothers plans another high-end neighborhood in Austin area
summary: Toll Brothers, the nation's 11th-largest homebuilder, is planning another high-end neighborhood in Leander, north of Austin. The company is targeting 112 acres to build 330 luxury homes, with half-million-dollar homes expected to be the focus. This development continues the trend of rapid growth in the Leander area.

title: Globalstar (GSAT) Stock Forecast 2025—Why It's a Good Investment
summary: Globalstar (GSAT) stock has surged over 500% in 2021 due to rumors of an Apple partnership for satellite communications in the new iPhone 13. While analysts have varying target prices, the company is seen as a good investment due to potential revenue increases from an Apple deal and the growing demand for satellite services, despite competition from Starlink and AST SpaceMobile.

title: Broadcom forecasts upbeat current-quarter sales on 5G bet
summary: Broadcom Inc. forecasted fourth-quarter revenue above Wall Street expectations, driven by strong demand for semiconductors due to 5G adoption and hybrid work models. The company's wireless division, including Apple as a major customer, is also expected to benefit from new iPhone launches. Broadcom's diversification into software business has helped mitigate supply chain disruptions.

title: Salt adds Universal remote to Apple TV service
summary: Swiss telco Salt has integrated a Universal Electronics-produced Apple TV remote into its service, designed specifically for Multichannel Video Program Distributors (MVPDs). The remote, launched by Salt in June, combines Bluetooth Low Energy and Infrared for universal control and is also available as a standalone accessory. This collaboration enhances the TV viewing experience for Salt's Apple TV 4K IPTV service customers.

title: Financial services giant Charles Schwab to add 450 jobs in Austin
summary: Charles Schwab, a major financial services company, announced an expansion in Austin that will create approximately 450 new jobs across various functions, including software development, engineering, and client services. This expansion is part of the company's significant growth in 2021, which saw record net new assets and brokerage accounts, and follows a company-wide 5% pay increase for employees. Schwab joins several other large corporations like Oracle, Apple, Amazon, Facebook, and Google in expanding their presence and job offerings in Austin, leveraging the city's tech talent pool.

title: Get Ready To Use Your iPhone As ID At The Airport
summary: Apple's digital ID initiative, allowing users to add their driver's license or state ID to the Wallet app, is launching soon. Arizona and Georgia will be the first states to accept these digital IDs at TSA checkpoints, with other states to follow. This privacy-focused feature aims to simplify identity verification for air travel and other transactions, using biometric authentication for security.

title: Arlo Offers Comprehensive Third-Party Compatibility With Amazon, Apple, Google, Samsung, And Others For Seamless Smart Home Security Experience
summary: Arlo Technologies announced enhanced compatibility for its smart home security systems with major platforms like Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit, Google Home Assistant, IFTTT, and Samsung SmartThings. These integrations provide users with seamless control over their Arlo devices through voice commands, notifications, and live video feeds on various smart home devices, reflecting Arlo's commitment to a robust and integrated security experience. The updates aim to offer peace of mind regardless of the user's preferred smart home ecosystem.

title: A new type of healing, supported by Apple
summary: Apple's Racial Equity and Justice Initiative has funded VamosVentures, a VC firm that invests in diverse, technology-enabled companies, including SweetBio. SweetBio, a Latinx-founded biotech startup, is developing an advanced wound care product made from Manuka honey to address chronic health issues like diabetic ulcers, particularly impacting communities of color. The article highlights a successful case study and SweetBio's plans for national scaling, supported by Apple and VamosVentures.

title: Women's Equality Day: How one ETF up nearly 20% this year promotes female empowerment
summary: Ahead of Women's Equality Day, two prominent female empowerment ETFs, WOMN and SHE, have achieved all-time highs. The Impact Shares YWCA Women's Empowerment ETF (WOMN) is up nearly 19% this year, while the SPDR SSGA Gender Diversity Index ETF (SHE) is up 17%. These thematic ETFs not only promote women's empowerment through their investment criteria but have also outperformed broader market indices like the Russell 1000.

title: Apple’s Proposed Protections Against Child Predators — a Challenge to Privacy?
summary: Apple announced a new system to identify child predatory content in its photo cloud, sparking varied reactions from law enforcement, child protection groups, and privacy defenders. The system involves on-device scanning of iCloud Photos using an algorithm to detect known child abuse images, raising concerns among critics about potential privacy invasions and governmental pressure to expand surveillance capabilities. The article discusses the technical implementation, immediate reactions, and the broader implications for Apple's long-standing commitment to user privacy amidst new challenges.

title: For Long-Term Investors, a QQQ-to-QQQM Switch May Make Sense
summary: The article discusses how long-term investors might benefit from switching from the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) to the Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM) due to QQQM's lower expense ratio. While QQQM is newer and less liquid, its cost savings over time make it an attractive option for buy-and-hold investors seeking exposure to the Nasdaq-100 Index. The Nasdaq-100 Index has consistently outperformed other benchmarks, making both ETFs appealing for growth-oriented portfolios.

title: IBM Closes New York City Offices Amid Rising Covid-19 Cases
summary: IBM has temporarily closed its New York City offices to all but essential staff due to a rise in Covid-19 cases in the city, aligning with IBM's health and safety protocols. Despite this, the company is still planning to reopen other U.S. locations by September. This decision comes as the delta variant causes other companies, including Apple, to re-evaluate their return-to-work strategies.

title: Universal Electronics' Apple TV remote now available through Deutsche Telekom
summary: Universal Electronics' (UEI) Apple TV remote, which features traditional buttons and Siri integration, is now being distributed by German telecommunications giant Deutsche Telekom to its MagentaTV subscribers. This remote, initially mistaken for an Apple-designed device, offers dedicated buttons for services like MagentaTV's program guide and utilizes Bluetooth Low Energy and infrared for control, along with Apple's Made for iPhone authentication chip for secure connectivity. It is currently available only through cable partners, not as a standalone purchase, distinguishing it from Apple's own revamped Siri Remote which lacks dedicated service buttons.

title: AMD Set To Become TSMC’s 2nd Largest Customer – Apple Car Chip Production Rumored For China
summary: AMD is projected to become TSMC's second-largest customer, behind Apple, due to strong growth across its chip segments, especially EPYC server products. This increased demand from AMD, Apple, and MediaTek is accelerating order flows for TSMC's 3nm process. Additionally, there are rumors that automotive chip production for an "Apple Car" might take place at TSMC's Nanjing facility using older 28nm process nodes.

title: MicroSectors™ Launches FANG & Innovation ETNs, 'BULZ' & 'BERZ'
summary: REX Shares, LLC announced the launch of two new MicroSectors Exchange Traded Notes (ETNs), BULZ and BERZ, issued by the Bank of Montreal. These ETNs are linked to the Solactive FANG Innovation Index, which tracks major U.S.-listed tech and internet/media companies. The products aim to offer sophisticated investors leveraged and inverse leveraged exposure to prominent technology and innovation stocks.

title: Apple selects 15 Black- and Brown-owned businesses for first-of-its-kind Impact Accelerator
summary: Apple has selected 15 Black- and Brown-owned businesses for its inaugural Impact Accelerator, part of the company’s Racial Equity and Justice Initiative. These businesses, focused on green technology and clean energy, will receive customized training, access to Apple experts, and opportunities to become Apple suppliers as the company works toward its 2030 carbon-neutral goal. The program aims to combat systemic barriers and advance innovative environmental solutions for communities most affected by climate change.

title: Arch Capital appoint high flyers to board
summary: Bermuda-based Arch Capital Group Ltd has appointed Francis Ebong and Eileen Mallesch to its board of directors. Mr. Ebong brings extensive technology and innovation experience from Alphabet's X and Facebook, while Ms. Mallesch offers over 30 years of finance and risk expertise including senior leadership roles at Nationwide and other significant board positions. These appointments aim to enhance the board's capabilities in fintech transformation and broaden its talent and outlook for future growth.

title: Samsung Is Using AI to Design Its Next Exynos Chipset for Smartphones
summary: Samsung is reportedly leveraging artificial intelligence, specifically Synopsys' DSO.ai tool, to design its next Exynos chipsets for smartphones. This AI-driven approach aims to automate and accelerate the complex chip development process, potentially improving performance and power efficiency. While Samsung has not confirmed which future products, such as the rumored Exynos 2200, will utilize these AI-designed chips, industry experts suggest AI is well-suited for arranging billions of transistors on a chip.

title: Microsoft Partnership Puts the 'S' & 'G' Into the 'E' in ESG
summary: Microsoft has partnered with Volt Energy to bring carbon-neutral electricity to underserved communities, addressing both environmental and social justice issues within the ESG framework. This initiative, while small in scale regarding initial power purchase, is seen as a significant step in pushing the boundaries of corporate environmental and social leadership. The article also highlights the Putnam Sustainable Leaders ETF (PLDR), which invests in companies like Microsoft that demonstrate proactive leadership in ESG issues and includes Microsoft as a top holding.

title: John Deere Moves Into Autonomous Tractors With Robots Startup Acquisition
summary: John Deere has acquired Bear Flag Robotics, a Silicon Valley startup, marking a significant move into autonomous tractor technology. The acquisition aims to bring entirely autonomous tractors to market, addressing severe labor issues in the agricultural industry. Bear Flag Robotics already has autonomous tractors with a limited set of customers, though details on wider release and pricing are not yet available.

title: Domino’s Pizza, Pinterest, GoDaddy e AMC: confira os 33 BDRs que estreiam na B3 nesta 2ª feira
summary: On August 16th, 33 new BDRs, including Domino's Pizza, Pinterest, GoDaddy, and AMC Entertainment, began trading on the B3. These BDRs allow Brazilian investors to access global company stocks, with significant growth in investor numbers and trading volumes since regulatory changes in 2020. The article highlights top-performing BDRs and the increasing interest of Brazilian investors in this market segment.

title: Unity Software stock jumps 10% as analysts credit it with dodging Apple's online-ad crackdown
summary: Unity Software's stock jumped 10% after analysts praised the company for navigating Apple's recent online advertisement policy changes. Unity found a workaround to help its customers continue effective advertising, leading to an upgraded outlook for the year. The company also announced the acquisition of Parsec for $320 million following a strong quarter.

title: Qualcomm Bids $4.6 Billion for Veoneer as Its New CEO Looks Beyond iPhone
summary: Qualcomm has made a $4.6 billion offer to acquire auto-technology company Veoneer Inc., aiming to outbid Magna International Inc. This strategic move highlights Qualcomm's new CEO's objective to diversify the company's business beyond its established mobile-phone chip market. The acquisition is driven by the increasing integration of chips into modern vehicles for automated driving and driver-assistance features.

title: QQQ Versus QQQJ: Who’s Winning the Battle?
summary: This article compares the performance of the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) and the Invesco NASDAQ Next Gen 100 ETF (QQQJ). QQQ, which focuses on large-cap tech companies, has outperformed QQQJ, a mid-cap focused ETF, across various timeframes. Chad Morganlander of Washington Crossing Advisors favors QQQ due to its higher quality large-cap names and stronger balance sheets.

title: AT&T's DirecTV to become standalone video business
summary: AT&T Inc.'s satellite television provider, DirecTV, will become a standalone video business as part of a deal with buyout firm TPG Capital. The new entity will launch DirecTv Stream, a platform providing access to various streaming services. AT&T will retain a 70% ownership stake, while TPG Capital will own 30% of the new company, which was valued significantly lower than AT&T's initial purchase price.

title: Jack Dorsey’s Square snaps up Australia’s Afterpay for $29bn
summary: Jack Dorsey's payments firm Square is set to acquire Australian buy now, pay later (BNPL) pioneer Afterpay for $29bn, marking the biggest buyout of an Australian firm. This acquisition highlights the growing popularity of the BNPL model and positions Square as a major global transactions giant. The deal will result in significant paydays for Afterpay's founders and validates the BNPL industry, creating a formidable competitor for existing players like Affirm, PayPal, and Klarna.

title: Stage is set in L.A. for its next studio
summary: Hudson Pacific Properties Inc. and Blackstone are developing Sunset Glenoaks Studios, a new $190 million facility with seven soundstages in Sun Valley, Los Angeles, to meet the surging demand for film and TV production facilities. The project aims to expand their existing "Sunset Studios" brand, which will total 42 soundstages upon completion, and other companies are also investing in new studio developments across L.A. in response to the booming entertainment industry and streaming services.

title: Consumer’s Claims About His Rights to iTunes Purchases Survives Motion to Dismiss
summary: A consumer's lawsuit against Apple Inc. regarding the meaning of "Buy" for digital content on iTunes has survived a motion to dismiss. David Andino claims Apple's use of "Buy" is misleading, suggesting full ownership when users only receive a limited license, potentially impacting millions of consumers and setting a precedent for digital media rights. The court found Andino had alleged an injury and that consumers could reasonably be confused by Apple's terminology.

title: Google founders have sold $1 billion in stock since May, the most since 2017
summary: Google co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin have sold over $1 billion worth of stock combined since May 2021, marking their first sales since 2017. Their stock sales, totaling more than $1.07 billion, occurred after the company's share price nearly tripled and Alphabet reported strong second-quarter earnings. Despite stepping down from executive roles in 2019, Page and Brin remain board members and control a majority of Alphabet's voting shares.

title: ANNUAL REPORT 2021 Arm: Business Strategy
summary: Arm's 2021 annual report highlights its business strategy as a leader in semiconductor technology, emphasizing its licensing model and significant investments in R&D since being acquired by SoftBank Group in 2016. The report details how these investments are leading to increasing revenue growth, particularly from 5G smartphone sales and the emerging Arm-based server chip market, despite challenges like the COVID-19 pandemic. It also touches on future growth drivers, including new markets like IoT and autonomous vehicles, and the planned sale of Arm to NVIDIA.
source: ソフトバンクグループ株式会社
source_domain: ソフトバンクグループ株式会社

title: Goldman Sachs boosts transaction banking biz with Fiserv tie-up
summary: Goldman Sachs is expanding its transaction banking business by partnering with Fiserv to offer services to Fiserv's clients, starting with cross-border supplier payments. This collaboration will allow Fiserv clients to use Goldman Sachs' cloud-based payment suite for domestic and foreign currency payments, managing FX and delivery for suppliers in over 125 currencies. The partnership aims to bring automation, efficiency, and cost savings to accounts payable for businesses with a global presence.

title: Sparkline Launches Intangible Value ETF, ‘ITAN’
summary: Sparkline Capital has launched the Sparkline Intangible Value ETF (ITAN), an actively managed fund that evaluates companies based on their "intangible value." This value is derived from four pillars: intellectual property, brand equity, human capital, and network effects, integrated with tangible assets using machine learning. The fund aims to provide a modern interpretation of value investing by focusing on high-quality companies with strong intangible drivers of growth.

title: Klarna’s paying for crowded market by buying Stocard for €110m – report
summary: Klarna is reportedly acquiring loyalty card startup Stocard for €110m, a move seen as diversification amidst a crowded Buy-Now-Pay-Later (BNPL) market. This acquisition follows Klarna's earlier purchase of HERO in July and allows them to integrate Stocard's mobile wallet and loyalty program into their offerings, potentially pushing their own card to Stocard's 60 million customers. Analysts suggest this strategy is driven by the booming but increasingly competitive BNPL sector and anticipated regulatory changes.

title: Tobi Lutke becomes Canada’s wealthiest company founder as Shopify shares soar
summary: Tobi Lutke, founder and CEO of Shopify Inc., has become Canada's wealthiest company founder as his stake in the e-commerce software provider reached US$13.3-billion. This surge in wealth is attributed to Shopify's stock crossing the $2,000 mark on the Toronto Stock Exchange and increasing optimism surrounding the company's second-quarter earnings. Analysts have raised their price targets for Shopify, anticipating its revenue to surpass US$1-billion for the first time in the June 30 quarter.

title: Better Buy: Invesco QQQ or Fidelity MSCI IT Index ETF
summary: This article compares the Invesco QQQ and Fidelity MSCI IT Index ETF, both strong technology-focused ETFs. While QQQ tracks the Nasdaq 100 and holds diverse sectors, the Fidelity ETF is a pure-play IT fund with broader diversification within the tech sector. The author concludes that the Fidelity ETF is the better buy due to its higher historical returns, lower expense ratio, and more consistent performance.

title: Carter's Inc. Jeff Jenkins Shares How the Brand Is Bringing Childhood Dreams to Life
summary: Jeff Jenkins, EVP of Global Marketing at Carter's Inc., discusses his decision to join the brand due to a deep emotional connection to parenthood. He highlights Carter's latest campaign featuring younger versions of American icons, including Mariah Carey's daughter, Monroe. Jenkins also emphasizes the importance of a strong leadership team and shares insights on mentorship and brand history.

title: Worried about Inflation? Consider Royalty Companies, 'INFL'
summary: The Horizon Kinetics Inflation Beneficiaries ETF (INFL) has rapidly gained popularity since its January launch, amassing $620 million due to increasing inflation fears. The fund invests in royalty companies, offering exposure to inflation-protective commodities without the complexities of futures markets. Horizon Kinetics emphasizes how royalty companies, with their asset-light business models and high gross margins, can benefit from inflation through ownership stakes in profitable resource extraction operations.

title: Raleigh tech firm Bandwidth is betting millions on a full return to the office
summary: Raleigh tech firm Bandwidth is committing millions to an in-person, five-day-a-week office model, a contrast to the prevailing hybrid work trend in the tech industry. CEO David Morken believes this is crucial for preserving company culture, backing this conviction with a new headquarters featuring a Montessori school for employees' children, and stating that productivity increased with remote work, but the company prioritizes "presence". The company is not mandating COVID-19 vaccines but is encouraging vaccination and will continue to hire over 1,000 workers.

title: Dow drops nearly 300 points on Friday, snaps 3-week winning streak
summary: U.S. stocks, including the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq Composite, fell on Friday, snapping three-week winning streaks, as inflation fears overshadowed strong retail sales and earnings. The Dow lost 299.17 points, or 0.86%, closing at 34,687.85 and ending the week down 0.52%. Consumer sentiment declined in early July, with inflation expectations rising to levels not seen since August 2008, contributing to the market sell-off.

title: Apple plans a ‘buy now, pay later’ service for all purchases
summary: Apple is developing a "buy now, pay later" service, internally called Apple Pay Later, for all Apple Pay purchases, rivaling offerings from Affirm and PayPal. The service will offer interest-free payments over four installments or interest-bearing payments over several months, with Goldman Sachs Group Inc. acting as the lender. This initiative aims to increase Apple Pay adoption and revenue for Apple's services business.

title: Boosted by Earnings Reports, S&P and Nasdaq Hit New Heights
summary: The S&P and Nasdaq indices reached new record highs due to strong earnings reports and the performance of mega-cap stocks, particularly in the technology sector. The article highlights how declining Treasury yields bolstered the growth thesis for mega-cap stocks, and discusses the Principal U.S. Mega-Cap ETF (USMC) as a way to capture these market movements. USMC tracks a modified equal-weighted index of mega-cap companies, focusing on minimizing volatility while seeking optimal outcomes.

title: Broadcom in talks to buy software firm SAS Institute - WSJ
summary: Broadcom Inc is reportedly in talks to acquire software firm SAS Institute Inc for a deal valued between $15 billion and $20 billion, according to the Wall Street Journal. This potential acquisition would allow Broadcom to expand its infrastructure software solutions business. SAS Institute provides data and analytics solutions to a wide range of customers globally across various industries.

title: Apple’s Co-Founder Has Harsh Words for the Company Over Its Control of Your Devices
summary: Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak has harshly criticized the company's stance against the "right-to-repair" movement, arguing that Apple's current practices restrict consumer access to repair information and parts. Wozniak contends that the early success of Apple was built on an open technological environment where users could understand and fix their devices. His comments align with growing pressure from regulators like the FTC against company-imposed repair restrictions.

title: Harley-Davidson's First LiveWire Brand Electric Motorcycle Launches
summary: Harley-Davidson has spun off its electric motorcycle business into a new sub-brand called LiveWire, launching its first model, the LiveWire One. The LiveWire One starts at $21,999, offers a 146-mile electric range, and can charge from zero to 100 percent in 60 minutes. It's essentially the same as the previous Harley-Davidson LiveWire but with new branding and a lower price point, making its physical debut on July 18th in Northern California.

title: Employers offer stipends for babysitting and tutoring to sweeten child-care benefits and win over workers
summary: Companies are increasingly offering enhanced child-care benefits, including backup care, stipends for tutoring and babysitting, and even college counseling, to attract and retain employees, especially working parents. This trend emerged during the Covid-19 pandemic as employers recognized the need to support workers with caregiving responsibilities, aiming to bring women back into the workforce and improve overall employee well-being. These expanded benefits also extend to support for older children and elderly family members, reflecting a broader shift in employer-employee relationships.

title: Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak is a right to repair advocate
summary: Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak has publicly expressed strong support for the right to repair movement, contrasting it with Apple's current practices. He believes that an open-source mindset, reminiscent of early Apple, is crucial, and companies inhibit repair rights to consolidate power and profit. Wozniak's comments come as President Biden considers new rules to expand consumer repair options.

title: LG swings battle for premium TV supremacy
summary: The COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated demand for premium TVs, with OLED TV shipments increasing significantly. LG Electronics has seen its share of the premium TV market rise to 28% by Q1, while Samsung's share declined. LG Display's OLED technology is driving this shift, with confidence in OLED's image quality, eye health benefits, and environmental advantages leading to continued market growth and diversification among TV manufacturers.

title: TSMC Wins Intel Order For Two 3nm CPUs To Regain Market Share Lost To AMD
summary: TSMC has secured an order from Intel to produce two 3nm CPUs, signaling Intel's strategy to regain market share lost to AMD, particularly in notebooks and data centers. This move marks a significant shift for Intel, which has historically relied on its own manufacturing facilities, and indicates a larger 3nm chip order for Intel than for Apple. Mass production for TSMC's 3nm process is expected to begin next year, with commercial output of Intel's chips following in 2023.

title: Focus: Qualcomm's new CEO eyes dominance in the laptop markets
summary: Qualcomm's new CEO, Cristiano Amon, plans to challenge Apple's dominance in the laptop market by developing energy-efficient chips with the help of former Apple chip architects. The company is also focusing on revenue growth from China for its smartphone chip business despite political tensions and aims to leverage its Nuvia acquisition to push 5G connectivity into laptops, providing custom-designed chips to compete with Apple. Amon also faces the challenge of potentially losing Apple as a modem chip customer and improving Qualcomm's brand recognition among consumers.

title: Qualcomm's new CEO eyes dominance in laptop markets
summary: Qualcomm's new CEO, Cristiano Amon, aims to dominate the laptop chip market by next year, challenging Apple's energy-efficient chips with custom-designed processors. The company plans to leverage its acquisition of Nuvia and a team of ex-Apple chip architects to create leading performance for battery-powered devices. Amon also anticipates significant revenue growth from China, despite political tensions, and is open to licensing Nuvia's designs for cloud computing data centers.

title: Medtronic Launches App-Based Study to Better Understand Relationship Between Atrial Fibrillation Disease Burden and Impact on Patient Outcomes
summary: Medtronic has launched the DEFINE AFib study, its first app-based research initiative, to investigate the relationship between atrial fibrillation (AF) burden and its impact on patient outcomes, quality of life, and healthcare utilization. The study will leverage data from Medtronic insertable cardiac monitors and the Discovery App, aiming to enroll approximately 5,000 patients with AF. This innovative approach to clinical research is designed to personalize AF management strategies through comprehensive data insights.

title: Google delays Chrome's blocking of tracking cookies to late 2023
summary: Google has announced a delay in fully blocking tracking cookies in its Chrome web browser until late 2023, nearly two years later than initially planned. This decision comes amidst antitrust concerns from competitors and regulators, with Google citing the need for sufficient time for public discussion and for the advertising industry to adapt. The delay has positively impacted shares of companies reliant on cookies, while regulatory bodies like Britain's CMA and the EU's competition commission are actively involved in overseeing Google's changes.

title: Passbook by Remitly Launches Suite of New Features
summary: Remitly's Passbook app has launched several new digital banking features to better serve immigrants, including a streamlined identity verification process, faster bank transfers, early payday access, person-to-person payments, and immediate activation of the Passbook Visa debit card. These enhancements aim to address common barriers immigrants face in accessing banking services, such as high fees and restrictive documentation. The company emphasizes its commitment to financial inclusion and responding to direct customer feedback to transform traditional financial processes.

title: App Tracking Transparency and the Future of App Measurement
summary: This whitepaper from Comscore discusses the implications of App Tracking Transparency (ATT) and other privacy changes, including iOS 14.5, on mobile app measurement for content publishers and advertisers. It explores how Comscore and similar providers can address measurement challenges while upholding user privacy. The paper highlights the evolving landscape of web browser environments and privacy regulations.

title: William Kaufman, Travelers Cos. Seal $185M Loan for 437 Madison Avenue
summary: The William Kaufman Organization and The Travelers Companies have closed a $185 million refinance loan for 437 Madison Avenue, with Wells Fargo providing the new debt. This loan retires $145 million in existing debt from Bank of America and Apple Bank. Eastdil Secured brokered the deal on behalf of the owners.

title: Wang: $ZH Remains My Top Pick
summary: Felix Wang, a China analyst at HedgeyeTech, reiterates Zhihu (ZH) as his top pick, highlighting its significant outperformance with a 40% gain since being designated a "best Long" three months prior. The article explains that ZH is focused on expanding its content e-commerce solutions (Zhi+) and establishing itself as a new content leader, particularly by embracing "videolization" and attracting diverse content creators. Wang draws a parallel between ZH and Bilibili (BILI), suggesting ZH has substantial growth potential if it can emulate BILI's success to reach a similar market capitalization.

title: Will Intuitive Surgical Be a Trillion-Dollar Stock by 2031?
summary: This article analyzes whether Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) can achieve a trillion-dollar market capitalization by 2031. It compares Intuitive's current market cap and growth trajectory to trillion-dollar tech companies, noting its dominance in robotic surgery market but also potential challenges from rivals and revenue growth limitations. Although reaching $1 trillion is deemed unlikely, the author remains optimistic about Intuitive Surgical as a strong long-term investment for healthcare portfolios.

title: Yu v. Apple Settles It: The CAFC is Suffering from a Prolonged Version of Alice in Wonderland Syndrome
summary: This article criticizes the Federal Circuit's handling of patent eligibility cases, particularly Yu v. Apple, arguing that the court is suffering from a "prolonged version of Alice in Wonderland Syndrome." The author contends that the court's interpretations of patent eligibility under 35 U.S.C. 101 are flawed, leading to tangible inventions being deemed abstract, and that the court disregards proper claim construction and statutory guidelines. The piece calls for Congress to address the perceived issues with patent eligibility jurisprudence.

title: Kopin Pancake Optics to ‘Reshape’ MR Headsets
summary: Kopin Corp has developed fully-plastic Pancake optics designed to significantly improve virtual, augmented, and mixed reality headsets. These new optics offer magnified image quality with a thinner and lighter form factor, aiming to overcome the bulkiness that has hindered consumer adoption. Kopin has filed multiple patents for this technology, which promises to make MR headsets much lighter and more compact.

title: Inland Northwest banks, credit unions keep branching out
summary: Despite the rise in electronic transactions, financial institutions in the Inland Northwest continue to invest in brick-and-mortar branches. Companies like Gesa Credit Union, Numerica Credit Union, and Banner Bank are expanding or renovating physical locations, recognizing that while digital banking is prevalent, clients still value face-to-face services and physical accessibility for relationship building and complex financial discussions. This trend suggests a hybrid approach where physical branches evolve to complement digital offerings, focusing on customer experience and trust.

title: Inside a factors-focused model portfolio
summary: Tim Courtney, CIO of Exencial Wealth Advisors, discusses his firm's all-equity model portfolio, highlighting its focus on Dimensional Fund Advisors (DFA) funds for their factor-based weighting towards value, small companies, and profitability, despite recent underperformance. He also addresses portfolio diversification, managing overlap, and specific international fund selections like the DFA International Small Cap Value fund and American Funds EuroPacific Growth fund.

title: This is how Black women can be seen, heard and promoted at work
summary: Susan Somersille Johnson, CMO for Prudential Financial Inc., shares her journey from a shy electrical engineer to a marketing leader, emphasizing the importance of networking, stepping out of one's comfort zone, and intentionality in career growth. She advises Black women to advocate for themselves by actively communicating their successes to leaders to ensure they are seen, heard, and promoted. Somersille Johnson also discusses the impact of the past year on her perspective as a Black woman and the importance of integrating one's life to foster diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

title: Bernstein recommends Sea, says Singapore-based internet company is a 'super app in the making'
summary: Bernstein recommends Sea Ltd., calling the Singapore-based internet company a "super app in the making" and initiating coverage with an outperform rating and a $350 price target. The investment firm believes Sea's strong execution track record ensures its dominance in various verticals, particularly highlighting the potential of its e-commerce arm, Shopee, to reach breakeven by 2025. Key drivers for the stock are expected to be Shopee's expansion in Latin America and grocery in Southeast Asia, leading to increased profitability.

title: Check out Target’s ‘before’ and ‘after’ store remodel photos
summary: Target Corp. is planning to remodel approximately 150 stores this year, which will include modern fixtures, updated lighting, enhanced experiences, and health and safety upgrades. These remodels are part of a larger initiative, with over 800 locations already upgraded in the past four years, and will feature improvements to guest services, order pickup, drive-up areas, and new "shop in shop" experiences with brands like Ulta Beauty, Apple, and Disney.

title: AT&T, Verizon Push Free iPhones for Long-Term Customers
summary: U.S. cellphone carriers like AT&T and Verizon are offering significant discounts on new smartphones, including free iPhones, to encourage long-term customer commitments. This strategy provides stability for carriers as they invest heavily in 5G network upgrades and reinforces their customer base. The promotions highlight a resurgence of wireless contracts in exchange for valuable device subsidies.

title: Microsoft’s Irish subsidiary posted £220bn profit in single year | Tax havens
summary: Microsoft's Irish subsidiary, Microsoft Round Island One, recorded a profit of $315 billion (£222 billion) in a single year, which is nearly three-quarters of Ireland's GDP, despite having no employees other than directors. The company is resident for tax purposes in Bermuda, which has no corporation tax, allowing it to pay no tax on income. This news emerged as G7 finance ministers discussed global minimum corporate tax rates to combat multinational tax avoidance.

title: The Moomoo Trading App Launches New Referral Program - Moomoo Ambassador
Yes, You Can Invest in a Tech-Less Nasdaq-100
summary: The article discusses the First Trust NASDAQ-100 Ex-Technology Sector Index Fund (QQXT), an ETF that allows investors to gain exposure to the Nasdaq-100 without the heavy technology sector allocation. This fund offers diversification away from tech and communication services while still providing growth potential and has historically outperformed the S&P 500 with less volatility. QQXT is presented as a compelling option for investors seeking growth outside of traditional tech-heavy portfolios.

title: Stock of the week - NVIDIA (27.05.2021)
summary: NVIDIA (NVDA.US) reported record first-quarter fiscal 2022 results, exceeding revenue and EPS expectations, driven by strong performance in Gaming, Data Center, and Professional Visualization platforms. The company also announced an upbeat Q2 forecast and a 4-for-1 stock split, which is seen as a bullish signal for investors. The growth is significantly boosted by the gaming sector during the pandemic and the increasing demand for its graphics cards by cryptocurrency miners.

title: Flex manufactures everything from hair dryers to the Mac Pro — what’s next?
summary: This article features an interview with Flex CEO Revathi Advaithi, discussing the company's diverse manufacturing operations from consumer electronics to autonomous driving systems, and the complex interplay of politics, automation, and global supply chains. Advaithi also addresses the ongoing chip shortage, the future of manufacturing in the US, and Flex's commitment to sustainability. She highlights the company's shift towards investing in healthcare and automotive sectors due to technological changes.

title: Expedia Group hires top execs from Apple and Verizon as part of leadership structure overhaul
summary: Expedia Group has hired Jon Gieselman from Apple and Rathi Murthy from Verizon Media as part of a significant leadership and brand overhaul aimed at simplifying its operations and boosting revenue. These appointments come amidst organizational disarray, declining revenues due to the pandemic, and a restructuring into four key pillars: Expedia Services, Expedia Brands, Expedia Marketplace, and Expedia for Business. The changes are intended to streamline the company after years of acquisitions and regain clarity in its mission.

title: P&G Earns Seventh Straight Gartner Supply Chain Mastery Award
summary: P&G has received its seventh consecutive Gartner Supply Chain Mastery Award, an achievement that highlights its long-term excellence in supply chain management. This recognition comes despite the extreme disruptions caused by the pandemic, which tested P&G's supply chain significantly. P&G is one of only five companies, including Apple, Amazon, McDonald’s, and Unilever, to be recognized in the elite "Master" category, which acknowledges consistent top performance over many years.

title: How Apple, Tim Cook give into China while pushing back against the US
summary: This article criticizes Apple and CEO Tim Cook for their perceived double standard in handling user data and human rights issues.
